reviews.review: I had the nacho burger here and it was good. I was hoping for a bit more flavor though. It basically has all the nacho condiments stacked within including some bacon. A bit too much going on in the burger. I chose it though hoping for more flavor. My wife had the sliders and enjoyed them. They were good. It's a sport bar and it is great in that. Plenty of tvs for all kinds of events and they'll change it to your preference. Our server was friendly and we didn't wait too long either. I could've have ate twice as good at burgr, the ramsey place in the same bldg for about the same price. Just saying. We chose it because we were going to the zombie burlesque show after right next door. Would probably come back to watch a game.
Great place to go and watch the football. Staff are nice and it's cool vibe, would definately visit again

$5 pitcher of beer was awesome but only if you have a college id, lol. They have beer pong tables and waitresses (not blondes) dressed in cheerleader outfits, quite interesting...

The food was not great through. I had the Philly cheese steak (which had one of the Blondie's specialties icon next to it) and the bread to steak and cheese sucked. There was a lot more bread then steak, wth? It was quite expensive, for simple American food. Also for water you got to get the bottled water, lol unbelievable. There's a lot of TV's for the sport lovers out there but I won't be coming back anytime soon.

Awesome drink special ! 
I really enjoyed their shot special! ONLY $4! Where on the strip can you find a shot that price !
Brandon, the bartender was super cool and helpful . 
Love  LOVE blonde's atmosphere! 
Who can say no to beer pong ! 

Thank you again Brandon . We will be back to see you!

Pros: 
-Location (for me anyway, staying at Planet Hollywood)
-The waitresses' cheerleader uniforms (it's a sports bar called Blondies, I'm allowed to be a chauvinist pig!)
-Some tables had personal beer taps, unfortunately I didn't get to take advantage of this.
-Menu selection was pretty good, a little something for everyone
-They burnt our first pizza a little (definitely still edible) but still gave us a 2nd pizza for free.

Cons:
-The burnt our pizza, but made up for it.
-I got a wrap that was pretty good, but I've had better.
-Value was just meh, probably decent for Vegas though.

With all the places to go in Vegas, Blondies is likely not a priority destination.  But it was good for a weekday lunch and some beers.

While the pizza is excellent  (supreme & chicken parmesan) the service is lousy. Cute servicers don't matter to straight women! My server watched me as I cleaned my own FILTHY table that we sat at. Argued that we didn't order a 2nd pizza & it took longer to get our plates than our 1st pizza. Don't ask for extras because you won't get them & good luck finding your server after she takes your order  (food runner brings your food) food runner had to get us our plates that we should have had before our pizza arrived.

Went with a couple of friends through my own recommendation. Had never been before but walked by and thought it seemed like a fun place. Simply put, I was wrong. We were seated quick enough and the atmosphere was nice. TV's everywhere, games, good drink specials. All of that was killed by the absolute horrible service. Our waitress took our orders and then came around twice before handing us our checks (our total bill came out to close to $100).   My beer sat empty , as well as two other drinks, for about 10 minutes before she noticed. The hardly ever smiled and didn't seem friendly at all. Then after she gave our checks and put our card she completely spaced out and came back with two copies because she split outlet our one order in two. Seriously? Anyways, it was disastrous by that alone. Food was mediocre to good. I suppose it could've been an isolated incident but since it did happen to me then it gets one star. Excel always.

What a joke! Got seated right away, given menus and then...nothing! All the waitresses seemed to be preoccupied at the front with so.ething because no one came to ask what we wanted to drink or anything. Me and my wife walked right out, nobody even noticed, bologna!
This is the worst restaurant I've ever been to.  Sodas are 4.00 each for a soda are you kidding me.  The food and service are horrible.

This spot has pretty good Jack In The Box food.

But beer makes it better.

After reading the reviews for this place, I was a bit apprehensive, but we were short on time as we were departing Planet Hollywood and Blondies was staring right at us. I suppose it was simply good timing for us because the place was virtually empty and we received prompt, friendly service. 

We started with the Garlic Bread Balls which were incredibly. Nice crunchy exterior, strong garlic flavor (which I enjoyed) and a soft interior. We polished them off in roughly five minutes. 

We decided on a large Pepperoni Pizza and we had to have them take it back initially because we forgot to ask for it well-done. Usually, I get a sense of frustration from the server and / or chef when I have to send food back but the waitress was kind about it and understood and the chef (who brought us our pizza the first time) brought it back out with a smile. 

The pizza tasted great. Perfect amount of sauce and the cheese used had a perfect sense of saltiness and it stuck to the pizza perfectly. The pepperoni tasted fresh and it was simply put, a good pizza. 

The staff was polite, prompt and our waitress kept our drinks filled. The only thing that keeps this from being a five-star review is that it's a little pricey for what you get, but I was happy to spend a little extra for an experience like this. It appears my trip to Blondies was a bit more pleasurable than some of the previous visitors who have given their reviews.

I think the most I've ever eaten here are the fries, because I've only, really, been here for after dinner drinks. My brother recommended the place a while back when I was in Vegas visiting and since then, I've always made a trip back to Blondie's.  

I was in Vegas last month to celebrate a friends birthday and we came here looking to drink and play some beer pong at about 1 in the morning. 

When you walk in, you can tell that Blondie's is a sports bar.  College, NBA and NFL sports Team Banners hanging from the ceiling and walls. Waitresses dressed like cheerleaders and (noticeably) no male waiters, only bartenders. 

We ended up getting a 64oz container of beer for only $35, which was perfect for beer pong, so we grabbed our cups, split up into teams (boys vs girls) and proceeded to attempt to destroy the boys. We failed, they beat us by two cups ... twice!

We stayed until 3 in the morning, a little drunk and very happy.  Good times all around!

Beer pong is decent, you have to wait for the whole tournament to end before starting a game, even if not competing.. Blah. Also, we paid for $20 entry fee for unlimited draft beer, and then they only give you like 3 choices of beer, which were the cheapest beer. I ended up paying more because I bought additional beer. The beer pong was the only thing that got them the 2 stars, service sucks and deal was misleading.

Great hot wings and fries ! 1 dozen = $13/ fries were about $4. We also split a club Sandwich which was plenty. Everything is served in big portions. Very tasty and strong house margaritas $5 each (on the rocks).  
Very happy with this find. There was no way we would have known about it without the signs we saw throughout Planet Hollywood shopping area so thanks for that! Service was excellent!

This place could do so much better in their food.  The food is what really brings this place down.  They shouldn't be so cheap with their servings and learn how to cook better.  We couldn't see the mushrooms in the burger.  They were non-existent!  And I had more lettuce in my BLT than anything else.  I little bit more than 1 piece of bacon in my sandwich, please.
The only good thing I can say about this place is that there are a lot of televisions.  And when we asked if we could have a tv on a certain game, they obliged.  The servers were friendly, but I swear they had to have been tweaking on something.  I'm afraid to find out since some of them were so jumpy.  I really thought their boobs might fall out of their outfits.  Another good thing about this place is the deal for beer.  The server did point out it's cheaper to get 5 beers for $25 instead of getting single beers.  She knew we were there to watch football.  Good job, Tweaker!!!  
Seriously, they need to get their food better, because it would be too easy to just drink when the food sucks.  And who needs more drunks in Vegas?

We were starving after we arrived in Vegas! Too bad we decided to eat here for our first venture. It was convenient but that's not saying a lot. So were lots of things.

What's not good here:

Expensive food that was just ok.

My meal didn't come out with the other three. I had to flag down a different server and ask about my meal. I guess our server was "done" with us.

You can't get a glass of ice water here. Well, you can but you have to pay for it. A bottle of water only, for several dollars! No tap water served here. No glass, no ice. Weird. Well, it's the "water is a top commodity" thing......

Ok, time to pay. Our hotel had given us coupons. We each had $10 off. We didn't want to do anything strange. We were just two couples who wanted to split the bill. Don't try this here. 

Our server would not, could not, did not split our bill. It had already been rung up she said and no way to change that now. So, we could only apply one coupon and she wasn't happy about that even as the bill had been rung up. She saw the coupons when we sat down but said nothing and did not take them. Had she perhaps not been in such a hurry to get back to her friends, maybe she could've paid more attention to our order. Then she went into her diatribe about us not having told her we were using coupons from the get-go, blah, bah, blah. Ok, whatever! We did, but whatever!

If this place wasn't so pricey for the rotten food (and no drinking water), we would not have wanted or cared about getting any $ off at all!

She said we could take it off her tip.

We did.

We decided to go and try out their unlimited pasta. We were seated right away but no one came to take our order. I had to ask one of the waitresses if she could send our waitress to our table. After that she came moments later. The pasta is $9.99 and you have the option to add meatballs or chicken for $2.99. My friend got the chicken and I got the meatballs and we both ordered the alfredo. The bowl was a good decent size and mines had two large meatballs. My friend finished his first and wanted his second bowl; but then he was told if he wanted more chicken he had to pay another $2.99. We were shocked, and so he ate his pasta without chicken. We then asked for boxes and they said they don't give boxes when the unlimited pasta is ordered. I asked to speak to the manager and he really didn't want to give us boxes. I told him you guys are only going to throw it away so what's the big deal of letting me take the food that I paid for home. One of his responses was we should already know they don't allow boxes with the unlimited pasta and he even compared it to running a red light! He said everyone knows not to run a red light. I told him that's against the law and its written in the handbook. Nowhere does it say you cannot take the pasta home. So to end it he says I'll bring one box and runs off; he didn't even give me a chance to respond to him. So, I had to stuff both of our food into one box. Even though the pasta was good I'm never going back because of that experience and on top of that their food is overpriced. We should've just went to Bubba Gump.

First time at Blondies, service is my only real complaint, it wasn't terrible but wasn't great. Everything just took a little longer than it should have to get to the table, although when the food did show up I was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. I got the buffalo chicken wrap and it was way better than I expected, would recommend! We got the chips and salsa as an appetizer, they were ok, typical store bought chips and mediocre salsa. Decent but not with the unnecessarily high price.

Good deal for the Breakfast special. $2.99 and that includes eggs, choice of sausage or bacon. The only disappointment I had was when the girl took a picture of us and came back trying to sell it. I told her NO & she kept bothering us. I lost my appetite!!!

Was seated by a very confused hostess and sat for 30 minutes with no staff contact. Shortly after, the very rude and obviously inexperienced hostess treated like it was our fault, saying "I told you guys that it would be a minute and you've totally overwhelmed the server. I should have had you wait". Then she told us that we'd have to sit at the bar because the server "is really overwhelmed, stressed, and won't take us".....that was it, we left. How the hell is a party of 3 that has yet to even speak to a server overwhelming?

Such a welcoming staff! Went the night before my Birthday and the waitresses gave a to-go coke saying "Happy Birthday". She was very on top of our group and kept coming back to make sure we were enjoying our time. Even gave us some great Vegas tips for our week stay. 

We went during the lunch happy hour and got the Fettuccini pasta bowl for $3.99. For the price there are no complaints!! However, I would not have paid $9.99 for a single serving of the pasta. The pasta sauce itself was very heavy. This is definitely the place to end your night and not start it. You will be leaving in a food coma!
You have many eating choices while walking around the Miracle Mile. This is not a bad place to pick.  It's your typical bar food with a bunch of TV sets.  Nothing great, nothing bad.

We stopped here because we had a cool voucher deal. If you want to watch a game this place has flat screens everywhere! So that's the awesome part. Waitress cheerleaders are cool, but the food is so so. Although the seating set up can be kind of squishy so make sure wherever you are sitting you're not in an area where you'll feel like a freeway lane. You want to come here more for some drinks and finger foods because you're pretty much watching the game!

Don't waste your time, or money here.

I bought a groupon (thank goodness I didn't pay full price) to try this "world's best sports bar" out. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! We both ordered a turkey club ($15.99, extra $2 for avocado), onion rings ($8.99), and curly fries ($6.99). The sandwich was okay, but the price includes ONLY the sandwich. Onion rings, I ate one (saturated in oil, the onion was mushy), and the waitress didn't offer to comp it or anything. Curly fries, no seasoning. 

Our waitress came 3 times. Once to take drink order, then to give us drinks and take food order, last time was to give us our check.

Never, ever visiting this place again.

On a visit to Las Vegas, with my Husband, he was craving a Good Hamburger, and he liked that Blondie's had alot of TV'S to watch Sports, so we decided to eat there!  WRONG CHOICE !!!  my husband had Sliders, that tasted good, but was way OVER priced,  and if he would of wanted french fries, they would of been, $6.00, I wasn't that hungry, which was a good thing, because all I ordered were the chips and salsa, and they were $5.95, I had a Margarita that was served in a plastic cup for $8.00, and the coke's are $3.95, oh! they only serve bottle water, and charge you $1.00, they say it is for charity?  We would never go back to this Restaurant !  Oh! they have Happy Hour!  which is $20.00, all you can drink, Domestic Beer and Well Drinks, which is really not a very good idea, when someone is young, and dumb !!!  I would say the only good thing about this Restaurant are all the TV's if you are a Sports Fan !

My sister and I were on our way out of Vegas and wanted to grab something to eat. We had been at the Miracle Mile Shops the day before and remembered there were many places to eat. We actually stopped at Ketchup first, but the employees had horrible attitudes and the menu was extremely limited. So off to find another place since we knew there were plenty of food places. And we ended up at Blondie's.

We walked in an the first issue was seating. There were plenty of seats in this bar, a frat boy's dream. We didn't sit outside since it's in front of one of the 2 theatres here and therefore quite loud. We went inside, but a man (we later found out was a friend of our waitress) leaning WAY back in his chair.  Then we moved all the way to the back room where the tables are made specifically to play beer pong. There was a group having fun and playing all the way in the back. That wasn't an issue until the table next to us decided (after we sat down) to move to the table behind us and start playing. So we moved again. 

Finally at a suitable table, our bubbly waitress came by and took our drink orders (don't order the iced tea, it's grossly overpriced). I ordered cheese sticks and onion rings and my sister ordered a steak quesadilla. They were both good, basic sports bar food. Nothing more, nothing less. 

It is a sports bar through and through, so remember that. Including the bathroom. Ugh (I only washed my hands). 

P.S. The Italian place next door looks lovely. I wish we had tried it.

Horrible, just say no.

We were going to Planet Hollywood for a show and I had just looked at groupon and saw Blondies.  So I thought the groupon would make it a decent price for a tourist trap and it was bar food, so we could find something there.  I looked online at menu and prices.  When we got there every item was $2 more than online.

Upon walking in, she went to sit us out on the walkway, but we asked for inside to watch the game.  Then she took us to the back where many tables of rowdy and obnoxious people were playing beer pong beside our table.  We asked to go back out front, but in the meantime, the odd waitress "yelled" and I do mean yelled snidely at the beer pong people that their food was "taking up her table"....well, they were doing what they were paying a hefty price for... ordering bad bar food at hefty prices as well as wasting and drinking a lot of beer.  However obnoxious, they were the demographic.  That being said, I am not.  So unless you are currently going to "keggers" you need to find another dinner spot.  The food was horribly cheap and generic boxed food.  Three waitresses were having a disagreement behind the bar.  Two business suit pervs were feeling up the waitresses.    And while, the waitress who yelled at the other customers continued to not ever smile, she was actually working hard and efficiently, just minus any smile or happiness.  She did keep us refilled and said thank you when we left.  

Pretty much, this place was a complete cluster f.  (and for me to use that term is the only way to describe it).  The vulgarity is the only way to describe the place.
Great weekday drink and breakfast specials: $3 breakfast, $2 bud lights, and $4 fireball shots. Good place to drink and watch sports.

This was my first visit to Blondies. What a great spot to grab a drink and something to eat. My server Fernanda was the best! Extremely attentive, great service and always had a smile on her face. I'll definitely be back again! She pointed out the drink and food specials for the time of day I was there. Made suggestions and asked if I had any questions. Some of the best service I've had in Las Vegas. Check this place out if you are in town!

My friends and I wanted to grab a cocktail, some lunch and watch the game and happened upon Blondies inside the Miricle Mile Shops at PH. Pretty much your typical sports bar, vast menu, a well stocked bar and waitresses in skimpy cheerleading outfits. A couple us were in the mood for breakfast and a couple of us were in the mood for lunch and the Blondies menu had something for everyone. I opted for a big breakfast sandwich that sounded absolutely delicious on the menu but when it arrived it left a lot to be desired, only at about half of it, not so good. The biggest suprise was one of my buddies ordred a pizza, now being from Chicago I never expect much in the way of pizza when traveling outside Chicago but this pizza was actually outstanding, perfect neopolitan(NY) style crust and generous toppings  and portion. 

All in all Blondies suited it's purpose, feed a group of us that all had a taste for something different, get some booze in our systems and watch the game. Good serve and ok food.

I ate at Blondies the other night and enjoyed my meal. I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious, cooked just the way I like it. The white rice wasn't great and a bit hard, but I find many restaurants can't get white rice right. The sweet potato fries were good despite some powdered sugar on them (the waitress warned me that they come with powdered sugar). The service was just OK, and that's why I gave it one less star. The server never checked back with us, and it was really loud, but, hey, it's a sports bar. However, I would go back just for the salmon and perhaps the chicken caesar salad wrap, which my friend had. My friend said it was good, and it looked good.

Couldn't even tell you how the food was cuz no one ever came to our table after seating our group of 12 on Saturday around noon. Staff walked by a couple times ignoring us, and no one came to even acknowledge us. 15 minutes later we just got up and left. I guess they rely on their numerous TV's to keep their guests distracted to cover up their poor service. Too bad we weren't there to watch a game, right Blondies? Shame on this joint.

AVOID THIS "RESTAURANT."  Just avoid it.

The service here is obscenely bad.  Possibly the worst I've ever encountered.  Had Nicole (or Nichole?) yesterday - she has star tattoos all over her arms and reddish hair.  We waited an HOUR for her to come by the table for refills while we waited for our food, and when we asked her "Miss?  Can we get refills?", she replied "Give me a second."  My more astute friend said to us at the table,"We've given her *3600* seconds!  Did she really just tell me to 'give her a second?'"  We actually thought that she may have been high or tweaked out, because her behavior was also quite erratic.  Sadly, I left a 10% tip, which I NEVER, EVER do, but the service was just that bad.

The food tasted okay, but it took us 2 hours to get three items, and the place was about 40% occupied.  

This place is AWFUL.

This place is a joke. We did not even eat there bc the hostess said and I quote' umm Hi yah we don't have any tables and like I don't know when another one will be open' really?!?!? So we walked away naturally and around the corner there were three four seat tables open. SMH  She is lucky we are locals and we might try again another day...

I don't really remember how we ended up here, but something about this place seemed to suck the energy right out of me! This place being a sports bar, maybe it was due to the fact that there was no good sports playing that day? The Buffalo Wings were actually quite good, the Cobb Salad was not bad, but the waitresses were useless, only performing the minimal amount of work their jobs required and lacked any sincerity or personality! Water is not free, you are forced to buy a bottle of their Blondies branded water. The washroom was disgusting! For a place that wasn't busy, more time should be spent cleaning the washrooms. This place was a BIG disappointment! 

Tip for the waitresses: If you're muffin topping, don't work somewhere where you have to wear a tight cheerleader outfit!

I only tried two appetizers when I was there but I liked them and the atmosphere. This is a sports bar, so it's loud and they have TVs everywhere. My brother wanted to watch a game, so I stopped in to say hello. I had some garlic balls and fried Mac & Cheese.....both yummy!! I def want to go back and try more. 

They have beer pong tables set up and have tournaments certain nights of the week. Seems like a fun place!

Terrible service and overpriced meals. 
'nough said.

Where do I even start? This place sucks ass! We sat down at the table and one of us ordered the Philly Cheesesteak.  The waitress says, "If you want onions or mushrooms, it's an extra .35 each"  WTF!!!!! A Philly cheesesteak sandwich is supposed to come with onions and mushrooms!   We ordered a large pizza, okay? Not some greesy dough covered in slimy, greasy cheese.  HORRIBLE! 
Then here's the kicker.  The waitress comes out with four glasses and four BOTTLED WATERS!  "Hold up," I say, "I didn't order bottled water...regular water is fine."  She says, "Water is a dollar a bottle...it all goes to charity."  WTF????  "Well, you really should have told us that when we asked for water," I replied.  The waitress just looked at me and said, "Do you want the waters or not?!"  
Oh HELL to the F*** no, you didn't, Bimbo. 
The next time she came out to our table and asked if there was anything else she could get for us, I just said, "Just more napkins...UNLESS...you charge for those too!"
Absolutely, hands down, the WORST restaurant in the Miracle Mile!

Great place to go to watch games while having some greasy bar food and a bucket of beer. Service is good too, the girls are spunky and efficient. you can make reservations a day in advance to reserve your seat for popular game days.

Located in Miracle Mile Shops at the Planet Hollywood. They do have outdoor seating, but it's in a mall so you'll be people watching. Lots of tvs, audio is on the bigger game that night. Some of the seating have beer taps which is awesome. Wings were great. I haven't tried the other food, it's quite expensive.

If you just wanna watch a game and drink, just go to a sports book with personal tvs and you'll save more money that way unless you're under 21.
Pretty cool spot with beer pong on Wednesdays. Expect slow service though especially for the all you can drink for $20. Even if the bar is slow

Ok here we go cool place.  We sat at the bar and 
Anna was was nice good service she came to us right  away I was kinda picky and she had all the time for us 
Food was good but the chicken wings  one of the 
SMALL ONES ..I ever got ....
can but full of flavor ...
Good place for tourists. .. or locals using Groupon LOL
 Just sit at the bar for a faster service ... 
Good luck ...

Went to dinner here May 18th before seeing Lionel Richie for my brother in laws birthday.  There were 5 of us total at the table.  Our waitress was less than attentive, but paid attention when we ordered and even read it back to confirm.  When the food showed up 2 of 5 meals were wrong but our waitress as mia to complain.  When she did show up she didn't seem to care things were wrong.   My sister had to go to the bar to get water that she'd asked for twice already.  When we asked about a discount for the wrong meals a whopping $4.50 was deducted REALLY???  When the bill came they tack on a 4% fee for using a credit card.  Unbelievable to say the least.  We will never go back to Blondies and I'd suggest others avoid it and get a better and cheaper meal somewhere else.

Meh. It's bad food and crap beer. But it's probably the best spot to grab a drink inside the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. Service is ok. If you're into drinking a whole bunch of crap beer, they do have unlimited drink wristband specials a couple of times a day. And they do often have $5 shots. So on the upside, while still overpriced, it's not as overpriced as some other places. But this is definitely not the kind of place you seek out. You just pop in for a beer when you're right near it.

I love the hot wings. They service a very generous amount of celery and carrots along with it with the wings. I usually have to ask for extras at other hot wing joint. I was a very satisfied customer.

Too expensive.  So-so service.  The garlic fries were ok.  Their Happy Hour only includes Bud and Coors, which you wouldn't know from their signs.  They no longer have the individual speakers so you can hear the audio from whichever game you choose.

Fraud! Don't go here. Went here because of signs saying there's an Oktoberfest with $5 foods and $2 beers and $5 beer mug for participating. It's not even a mug it's like a mini wine glass. Not even close to what all the signs say. The waitresses don't even know what it's all about. And the food isn't what they say. 

It's sad you're spending all this money and you can't get what you want from what they offer on the sign. 

Won't come here again! Waste of money and time. Left hungry and thirsty. I felt bad for the kids too.
One of my favorite breakfast spots in addition to being a sports bar.  Opens at 7 am, and the breakfast is great and cheap!  The food is great and coffee is good too!

Went here a few weeks ago on a Sunday morning and had a blast with some girlfriends! Shout out to the best waitress Cristen!! She was so attentive and funny! The wings that she suggested were definitely on point. We will be back again for sure thanks to the great food and service!!!
My favorite sports bar on the strip. Love the staff! Everyone is friendly and attentive!
Nachos were horrible.  Bar was fun with lots of half naked women.  Beer pong was great.  Don't eat here, just have some beers.  Average at best if you want to watch the game.  Big screens not HD.
Went here yesterday and i must say it definitely is a cool sports bar but the food is over priced . Total rip off.

I'm glad I read Jeannie L's review because it put me in perspective. I've always written reviews based on "what it is". I was ready to give this place a "1" due to the fact that this place is rated as "One of the Top 5 Sports Bars on the Strip" and it shouldn't be. Based on that, I'd give it a "1". Based on what you should expect from a Sports Bar, it ends up being a "3". Average food, a $20 all you can drink Happy Hour (3 PM - 6 PM) for well drinks and house beers, enough TV's, indifferent service (it feels like they are doing you a favor serving you). You can find hotties anywhere in Las Vegas so what makes their servers different? Found their prices to be higher than your average Las Vegas Bar. I won't be back.
Food was ok but the service was slow. Some servers ran around with their heads cut off while others just stood around.

If I were the owners of this establishment I would be so embarrassed! The servers are more concerned about their outfits than serving food! The waitress was cranky and showed no interest in serving us. She expected us to order the moment we sat down and then once we ordered she was never seen again!  We had to pay at the bar because she literally vanished! We spent most of our meal with angry guests on front of us complaining about how the restaurant overcharged their cards, and the waitress pretended she didn't know how to fix it. The food was greasy and not worth the price paid. And to add insult to injury both people in my party had an allergic reaction to the food! 
There are too many other options to settle for bad food and crappy service! I really wish I knew how to contact the owners because we spoke to the manager and he did nothing! Never again!
Food and beer are great, really friendly staff.  Danielle was a diamond! Really funny bar, would highly recommend for you're trip to Vegas!

This place is great for guys. Tones of TV's with multiple sports on. They have beer pong tables and sell a beer pong pack with cups and balls for $5. 

Happy hour was between 3pm-6pm. Really cheap beer. 

The waitresses were friendly, helpful and very talkative. The barman was also a really nice guy. 

Great for groups.

Update:  The money was remedied, so I gave it an extra star for that and just having a great time with my friends.  

Went out to party in Vegas last week for Pre New Year's Eve celebration at Blondies. Somebody had to screw something up. The i***t bartender charged us for another party's bill of $138.00 ON TOP of our own overpriced bill!!!   And it is not like we signed for that bill either.  We didn't notice this until 2 days after when we checked our account. Husband did call the manager said to get back to them as they are sure that bill should be refunded back to our account (of course that bill will first be deducted from our account, good thing we are not poor people).  I guess they have a tendency to do this to their clients...so people beware of this carelessness.

We watched the Kentucky - Louisville Final Four Game.
Great Service, Great Drinks, Good Food.

Really enjoyed being here for the game. Sat with other fans - from Ohio State and Kansas.....

I will come back here....enjoyed.

To be honest, it is Vegas after all, so i can't say I was expecting much. That said the bar is nice. Nice large TVs and a cool atmosphere, but the staff ruins the whole experience. We came here to watch the Charger game and they weren't even showing it. Still we pressed on and walked up to the Hostess booth. We were flat out ignored for 3 plays before I got annoyed and tried to grab the attention of the Hostess, who had been standing there the whole time with her finger in the air telling us to wait. I was told to "Hold on." And so I did, much to my dismay. When she finally looked up she said nothing, just stared. We asked for a table and asked how long the wait was. Honestly the place was packed and so I expected to wait, but the girl said "I don't know there's a list." We had to ask to be put on it and she said "What's your number?" and then turned around and walked off. I wasn't even sure she had actually written it down. We went in to try and grab a beer at the bar, but the bartenders were rude and didn't care. One of the hostesses ran into me and then rolled her eyes and walked away. Mind blown.... 

We found ourselves wandering into a seedy looking little bar across the way called The Stripper Bar. I thought we were about to go in for round two, but the service was amazing, the food was good, they were playing our game, they had better deals on drinks and our waitress did a pretty good dance on the pole at half time. I don't care if there is a 50 foot stripper right outside of the place. And aside from that, Blondies' TVs are so freaking huge we were able to watch their screens from our seats in the bar, we just turned around. I'll pick this place over Blondies any day.

Why do people get so offended by this place? Did you not go to college? This is essentially a college bar on the strip. Who goes to a college bar to be blown away by the food? 
If you go here do the following

Go during happy hour, its all you can drink

Go on college night, its all you can drink.

Go to play beer pong

Go to drink on the CHEAP on the strip

Go to watch some sports

Outside that DONT GO, it is not a place for date night or to have a 5 star meal. I mean this reminds me exactly of where I drank in college.

we came here only for wings! late! saturday night around 1am. no wait. no one was even there. i ordered the wings and wanted them mild. there were basically naked with a little sauce. but were actually good, we were too tried to order or ask for anything else. lol.

Amazing sports bar! This is what it is all about. Great waitresses cold beer and so many TVs you WILL find the game that you want.

This is a sports bar, so come here to relaxed and have a great time. If you want some great deals on beer then this is your place.

Great to come and relax and chill out!

Got their appetizer platter for 20 bucks. It included jalapeño poppers, wings, chicken strips and macaroni and cheese balls. Wasn't the most amazing food but it definitely got its job done and filled us up. My boyfriend got a jack and coke for 10 BUCKS! Clubs charge this much, not sports bar! Not bad but nothing special.

Returned back to Blondies after not so good past experience. Due to bad review regarding one of their crappy cracked out severs we were asked to come back on owner vonns behalf for complimentary drinks. I decided to take my brothers into blondies for some drinks and appetizers. This time I chose to sit at the bar/ table  with 5 of my buddies. We ordered tap beers and some appetizers. Chicken wings, potato skins, nachos and some fried pickles. Bartender was excessively slow for how dead the restaurant was for a Friday. Food was just blah , bland bar food which was  under cooked and overly fried which hid the frozen flavor I assume. Waited around for this Vonn guy who claimed to be the owner but no one was able to get ahold of him. 

All the of the staff were sitting in the back booth on their phones, and eating. I asked multiple times for side of napkins and ranches ( almost walked into the kitchen myself). Place is trash needless to say, restrooms were gross, next time use Mother Nature it will be a lot cleaner. 

I just can't get with this place and I'm not sure why the health department continues to allow this place to run. Chicken bones on the tables and floors. Staff was less than helpful everyone was "busy" like my last experience. Trash was scattered all around the restaurant while everyone just walked over it. I wanted to throw up my blondies me

They need a HUGE makeover!!

More like 3.5/5

$13 for cheese steak sandwich, no fries? Thats strange

Service was alright, nothing spectacular

I do like the all you can eat Pasta for 9.99

I'd eat here again

Stopped in because we needed a small snack and wanted to watch the World Series.  If you are only going to drink and watch sports, this is a great spot, but if you want to eat you will be disappointed.  The food was subpar and generic at best.  Wings were small and tasted nothing but red hot sauce. He potato skins had no flavor at all.  I didn't expect a high end meal, but did think there would be some standards inside the PH.

4 stars for their all- you- can- drink beer pong deal from 3-6pm for $20 per person.  

1 star for shorting me change on my bill!!  i ordered chips and salsa and the total was $6.34 (or something like that).  I gave her $10 and the waitress gave me back $3 and said, sorry we're out of change.  I couldn't believe it!!  So I said, "because you guys don't have any change, you're charging me more for my food and shorting me my change??"  She said, "uh..yeah...i guess!"  I said, "I would think you would give me back $4 versus $3.  This is crazy!!"  Poor waitress..not very bright, of course, didn't even get it so I let it go. 

I know it's only $0.64, but that's not the point.  That's absurd that they would even do something like that!!  I'm still in shock!

Ate at Blondies on Friday of our Vegas trip. The server was nice, but wasn't very attentive. As others have noted, there is no free tap water, but they did give the first round of bottled waters free. They gave 3 bottles for 5 people. Food was mediocre bar food at best, not worth anything near the price we paid for it!

They had everything but pepper  on the table, wanted to ask for pepper but our waitress was in the kitchen talking. I was surprised when we got the check and a 20% gratuity was included. We left what we thought was fair considering the service we received  (15%) and the waitress followed us outside to let us know we had short changed her. When informed of that we didn't think she deserved that amount she told us "It is called a tip, and it is mandatory!" We ended up just walking away.

My least favorite part was about 2 hours later when the stomach problems started for 4 out of 5 of us. All 4 of us ate the hot wings (which were probably the best part of the meal) and ended up with stomach issues for the rest of the trip!

I don't think I'll ever eat here again!

I have to say that for the semi-bad rating i'm giving this place, I have been here twice.  I don't know why, it just seemed to be the right place at the right time.  There really isn't anything special about this place, it seems like your run of the mill sports bar.  The food was mediocre and the service was even worse.  And when I asked for water (everybody needs water in vegas; dehydration from the heat and excessive drinking) they only offered bottle water that was a $1.  I mean c'mon really?  Charging me for water?  So i opted for the cocktail instead (which also sucked, stick with beer).

Food was very mediocre, and even for Vegas the price:quality ratio was offensive. The service was also very poor, leaving several from our normally carefree group a bit irritated. We showed up as a party of 8 split in half for ease of seating while it was busy but not packed - many tables were empty, no line, between lunch and game time. I had a $15 pulled pork sandwich, fries were a few bucks extra. The bun was stale and the pulled pork was the mass produced overly tangy bbq goop you get in a tub at the grocery store. I ordered a can of Guinness which overflowed the glass after a proper pour, so either their pints run small or the glass was dirty. The service was laughably bad, missed and forgotten drink orders throughout, and we waited far too long for the check.

Dirty, smelly, and stale. Waitress was nice an accommodating but even she couldn't overcome the high prices and generic atmosphere. If you want a college town bar environment, then Blondies is for you. If not then stay away.

Went at lunchtime on a Thursday.  The service was okay.  They make you pay for bottled water instead of a glass of water.  Food was just okay.

The bathroom was disgusting.  I can't believe this place gets away with this, being in a mall with upper class stores!  The paint on the flooring in front of the toilet was all worn away and greyish looking.  There was graffiti on the sanitary recepticle and no bag inside it.  Everything was dirty and worn out looking.  Yuck!

I definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone and would not return.  There are much better places to try in Las Vegas!

Was promptly seated by host only to be ignored by any waitress for 10 minutes. I called over the host and said we haven't been serviced. She grabbed a waitress walking by and said something to which that waitress said she'd be right over. She never came. 15 minutes after arriving and being ignored we left. So sad. We had heard so many good things about this place. It was a Monday about 1:15 p.m. and the place was hardly busy. Too many great options in Miracle Mile to put up with incompetent wait staff and absentee management.

$10 for a mug of beer, with the amount equivalent to 1 1/2 bottles. Not worth it. I chose a Cherry Bomb...thing, next where I was able to keep the glass, so that made me feel less cheated.

The idea of this place is great, and I wish we had Blondie's over in Miami, because those tables were wonderfully huge. But it's obvious you're paying extra money for where you're at, and there weren't even any drink specials. We were there from around 4:30 until 6:30 or 7ish, when you'd figure there would be a happy hour.

I think a lot of people are going to Blondie's for the wrong reasons. The thing is you gotta walk into this place knowing what you're getting yourself into. Blondie's is basically a Hooters that hosts beer pong games. Forget about the food, forget about anything else but beer and you'll be okay. Am I saying it makes up for their poor service and prick bartenders? Nope. But I'm just making a point.

I went here last night, pretty damn late with a group of guys (a majority of whom were Marines). We went to play beer pong pretty much and that is what we did. The beer pong tables were pretty packed and everyone around us was having a good time. It was pretty loud and fun and all the people around us were nice (tossing back balls, joking, just having a good time). It was 4th of July weekend so we were all doing what Americans do... drinking beer and yelling about how much we love America.

Would I go out of my way to eat here? No. Would I go back if I weren't with a bunch of Marines playing beer pong? No. But it's a fun time for what it is.

Meh. Greasy food served at Vegas prices. Four of us went there on Tuesday, the place was NOT busy; a dozen or so patrons in the place- plenty of seats @ the bar. The waitress (pleasant and friendly) took an inordinate amount of time to wait on us, process our order and actually get us our food & drinks ( cold curly fries are NOT tasty). Overall, we were underwhelmed. Skip it. The waitstaff wasn't taxed by a bunch of full tables, the bartender was just hanging out and the two cooks/managers/delivery guys that dropped off our food appeared unhurried and laid back......so the problem might be managements approach to motivating the staff to move faster - and prepare BETTER FOOD !! I give this place 1 Lemmon, 1 pear and an orange.

The worst service in all of Las Vegas. We waited 45 minutes for our food. It was lunch and it was not busy at all. When we asked to speak to the manager, she totally avoided us. So we gave her 5 minutes to come to our table. So when she did not come, we told the waiter we were leaving. All 15 of us stood up and left. We just paid for our drinks. I would not go to this place if I were you. There are far better serviced places @ the Miracle Mile shops @ Planet Hollywood. Look up Hash-Hash a go go. Far better place.
This place I happening!!  Good drinks, food and a place to watch sports n UFC

What a scam...."resort charge" when you pay by credit card. Not that anyone tells you before you order either. 
They simply add 4% to your bill as a resort fee.  

What a ridiculous fee for a crappy restaurant.

Never again

Dirty restrooms, cold, old, frozen food, terrible service, no visible manager to talk about an issue, bartender handle complains. Expensive food 25 dlls for a very small dozen of wings witch it has more bone that meat 35 dlls for a fatty tasteless burn ribeye, 25 dlls for a burn break a part hamburger with hard as a rock hamburger bun plus a 8 dlls side of 8 pieces steak fries don't even mention a overcooked salmon and chicken breast

OH. The food is just....horrible. 

And that's all I can really say about this place. 

If you get a salad, you will regret it. If you get the pizza, it will make Pizza Hut taste like gourmet pizza heaven. The only semi-decent food are the chicken wings (get them mild or spicy). Plus, the food is super expensive for what you get. I'm talking about $4 for soft drinks, $6 bucks for a basket of fries, $15 for sandwich wraps. I usually have no qualms about paying for food, but when it sucks, it just makes me frustrated.  

SO. I'd give this place only 1 star for the food, but I give it an extra star because it's a fun place to watch sports games. Lots of televisions, loud and fun crowd! And I gave it another star because our waitress was super friendly and nice. We were pretty needy (more BBQ sauce please! refill on lemonade please! can we have more salad dressing?) but she was great. I don't remember her name...I just remember she was a blonde girl.

Went here late at night for some food. There is not too much to say about this place. It was pretty empty for a Sunday night, probably because it is nestled deep in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood that are mostly closed that late. We ordered Mozzarella sticks and each got a wrap and a drink. The Mozz sticks were good, and the wraps were fine, but both were pretty expensive. The bill was almost $70 which I felt was a bit excessive for the amount of food we got. The wraps did not even come with fries. I'm sure this place is more fun with more people, when it's more of a bar than a late night restaurant. This is just my experience.

The waitresses wear Cheerleader uniforms, and were pretty attentive, though the bartender was slow with our drinks.

maybe a 1.5 stars for me, maybe.

so my friends and i stroll in here while our trek through miracle mile shops at planet hollywood. the only reason why i walked in here was for the beer pong. another beer pong joint on the strip besides oshea's?! awesome! of course i compare the two: oshea's wins hands down. cheaper and better service.

so my friends and i get a table here, get our beer and set up. round one, i lost, that's cool, there really are no losers in this game anyways (that's what i tell myself when i'm stuck with more beer than i can handle). then again, i already had a 1/2 yard of some sort of vegas juice in my system, so i wasn't feeling like chugging more down. a friend gets more beer and we are setting up for a next game. next thing we know, we are all being told to finish up our games b.c they are setting up for a ufc fight. they start taking down tables and take cups to re-fill our pitchers. excuse me, wtf?!?! why would your guys at the bar sell us beer for beer pong if they know you're gonna set up for a fight in a bit. that's some shady ass shit!!! so i ask where can we sit to finish our beer. "go talk to the hostess honey, all these tables are reserved."

"honey?! who you callin' honey?!?!" then i start on some rant, yellin' and throwing punches in the air, one of them actually punching one of the bartenders out! as the rest of my fellow beer pong patrons cheer me on and join in on the ass kicking fun!!

yeah, that never really happened, but all i gotta say is that you got a place with bartenders sportin' mohawks, seriously, every single one of them had one! i dunno if it's a requirement, but that should've given me the clue to stay away. douchebags might as well have been wearing ed hardy shirts.

we ended up getting a seat b.c we just sat down at a table and a waitress came by with a menu. the food was your typical bar food. but i was inebriated so my mini corn dogs and fries with honey mustard sauce was poifect fro my drunchies.

the only reason for 1.5 stars is the beer pong, i will always have a place in my heart for beer pong.

We wanted to watch some football and tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt but sadly all is true, everything about this place SUCKED!!! If you're staying @ PH towers or shopping @ the mall save yourself and your wallet! Avoid this place! You would probably get better service and a free cup of water @ McDonald's lol!

This place was complete crap we got a crappy waitress with an attitude never check once to see if we wanted something more to drink didn't bring no napkins are forks and slammed the glass of water on the table and has the audacity to ask why I didn't leave her a tip dumb blondes I'll never eat here again!!!

TV's are plentiful, to say the least. They have approximately 2 gazillion of them.
They crank up some sweet tunes during commercial breaks, which is a fantastic idea and really increases the enjoyment of the sporting events.
The food is mediocre at best.
The service is horrendous. Your waitress will sometimes disappear for 20-30 minutes. 
The prices are high, given the low quality and bad service.
I almost dropped them to ONE STAR, since they have a BYU flag. BYU sucks and their fans (by and large) don't drink... or tip.
If I could give this place a negative review is I would do so. Worst service ever girls like you and outfits but food wasn't good drinks were way too expensive. Skipping find another place.

Staff was friendly and great service but that was about the only plus. 
For the of their frozen burger patty I could have walked down the way and ate at a gourmet burger spot for about $2 dollar more and Im sure it would have had twice the flavor. Over priced beer, over priced food. With all the options in Vegas spend your money else where. There was nothing that made this place stand out as a cut above the rest.

I wish I could give this place a big fat ZERO star! This place SUCKS! Food was terrible, service was terrible and the manager asked me "so...what do you want from me?" After I complained about the service...or lack thereof. Party of 8 and they came to our table once. BOOO!!! Close this terrible place down! Wish I would've read the reviews before coming here.

We came here for a Monday brunch.  Nothing special.  Although the place was not crowded at 11:30 am, it took us 1/2 hour for us to get our order.  No points there, food was average.  Although we did notice 4 people playing beer pong at the backside of the restaurant.  Our waitress was friendly but seemed elsewhere.

A poor excuse for a sports bar. Granted, we ate here purely to be able to dine "al fresco" (or as much as it can be while in a casino), but the beer selection is abysmal and my meal wasn't really even up to bar food standards. The tomato soup tastes like it came from a can and my spinach salad had unidentifiable ingredients. Plus, it was all over priced.

Also, FYI to the waitresses, when a customer order san appetizer, it should come out BEFORE the rest of the meal.

Blondies has a great "sports bar" ambiance and a laid-back "be yourself" vibe.  I love the pizza and the cute young girls in cheerleader outfits.  I'm not even into sports yet visit Blondies about every 2 months.  The beer specials are good.  My only complaint would be the small and inadequate bathrooms - but, who spends much time in there, right?

I came here on St. Patty's Day in 2008 and it was so much fun!!!

We paid $30 (or was it $25) for all you can drink... and boy did we have our fill of green beer!!!! 

They have beer pong tables... which was A LOT of fun... it's a very casual and kick-back atmosphere and the people there are really down to earth and cool.

It seemed like everyone there was there to have fun.. no drama, no frills.. just plain old fun!!!

Went here to watch some football games and have a few drinks. We were staying in Planet Hollywood so it was convenient and good for a group of people. We got in and got a table right away. The tables are pretty cool because they have taps right in the middle and you can poor your own beer and pay by how much you drink. That would have been awesome for our rather large group except the selection is limited on what beers you can choose and our waitress kept encouraging us to get buckets of beer because she didn't want to deal with the hassle of turning on the taps. We ended up getting buckets of beer because she kept pushing us to even though we really wanted draft beers. It became evident later that she was just lazy and didn't want to come back and serve us. I think she checked on us one time in the several hours we were there. We had to go to the bar to order more beers because she decided to sit in a booth in the back and fold silverware. I know the forks won't roll up in the napkins themselves but come on check on your tables. We had to hand deliver our credit cards to her because the bar couldn't check us out. Overpriced beers even for Vegas and the service is terrible. Go elsewhere.

We were in a rush to grab dinner before a show and stopped in at Blondie's because there was no wait and it fit our budget. They were out of most of their beers (probably thanks to it being New Year's week). Out of our group of six, none of us were overly impressed with the food. My turkey wrap was okay at best and the pizza was disgusting.

Service was slow and almost dismissive, despite the fact that they weren't overly busy.

There was a very loud group taking up the entire back half of the restaurant. I of all people totally understand others wanting to have a good time, but the guys who came over and insisted on "starting up a conversation" with our group of girls (a.k.a. making a poor attempt to hit on us) disturbed the end of a below average meal and also got in the way of us trying to pay our checks. I would have had a more pleasant experience eating fast food. Perhaps if we wanted to just stop in for cheap light beer and beer pong (ugh) we would have enjoyed ourselves more.

went to blondies with a group of 9 people. we were seated immediately which was impressive. the only plus of the evening. we were told by the waitress it was impossible to all have separate bills. a little annoying...then when the food arrived it was horrible. 2 entrees were sent back. it was not offered as would be typical to order something else. waitresses simply said you didnt like it? nope. and she just took it. then delivered a pizza that was ordered. the two girls splitting it started eating and realized it wasn't what they ordered. when we called the waitress back over and explained the situation her response was that she noticed it was the wrong pizza and asked the cook but he said it was the pizza for our table. she said she double checked her order to make sure she put it in right and she did. ....so she brought the wrong pizza to the table ANYWAY and never said anything.......hoping we wouldn't notice???? What?  she then offered to bring it back and just throw the toppings that were supposed to be on it on there.  we said no bc its supposed to be cooked on. didnt even offer to get a new pizza. at that point another person at the table asked for a side of ranch and were advised it would be extra!!! we asked to speak to a manager. who happily skipped to out table. seemed somewhat childish, flippant and unprofessional for someone in his position addressing a customer complaint. each person who talked to him he litterally hopped to. he then offered to remove only half of the cost of the pizza bc half was eaten before we noticed it was the wrong one. to add to it the waitress said she couldn't bring 6waters with the food bc it was too much to carry. and then asked asked we wanted a box to take the rest of that pizza home...........horrible service. overpriced food and drink (oh btw. they brought the wrong drinks too), unprofessional and d effinately dont knkw thier own menus. one of our top worst experiences.

I've been here twice now. Nice sports bar to grab beers, bar food and watch some games. Several TV's and fun atmosphere.  Didn't partake but they had some beer pong tables and other games to add to the mix. Not a great selection of on tap beers for a place like this but I was able to find a couple I liked. Probably come back for a game and beer.

Don't order the all you can eat pasta. The marinara sauce was watery and had no flavor. Service was okay. If you do like pasta and watery sauce, order one order not the all you can eat. The garlic bread was tasty but that was it. There were six of us and we all ordered the all you an eat. The people who ordered the chicken Alfredo pasta said the chicken had no flavor and was rubbery.

I work in the mall; but came here after a 9 hour shift. I was here for a dodgers game (3-4hours). I had my waiter come with a bill every 30 minutes. It was horrible I could have just watched the game from home. These people wanted m gone ASAP. I spent about $100at the sports bar me and my wife and felt like they  antes me out. Not a he beat it peace to watch a game. Stay home watch the game there or go to Ketchup Bar. No rush to leave. Bet racist too. People in front of me where white and never were hurried to leave and I was shown the bill 3 times in les then 4 hours.

This review only focuses on breakfast.  This place is located in the Miracle Mile shops near one of the "squares" with entertainment and other eateries.  There were at least 4 other restaurants advertising cheap breakfasts.  This place had a sign for $2.99 eggs, meat and potatoes.  When we sat down I immediately noticed that toast was extra and guess what?  It was $2.99 too!  They also charge $2,00 for coffee so they actually are more expensive than the other places.

On the positive side, the food was good and the service quick.  As a plus, it's a sports bar so all of the tv's had ESPN on which I watched while I ate.

My wife and I split an order of toast to get a sense of satisfaction.

Worst service, we get there and ask for seating outside but she said we can't put 5 people in front. (Tons of empty tables). Then we ask for the wooden booth towards front and there are drinks on it and we would have waited but she led us back upfront and said she can put a 5 th chair at a 4 top, I asked if she can put two tables together she said no, here's your 5 th chair, and she walked away. 
Terrible so-called fettuccine Alfredo. Our server Jessica seemed to be annoyed at the fact that my family sat in her section. She rushed to hear our drink order then she came back and I had to rattle everyone's order off as if I was an auctioneer because she had no patience. So when she cut me off as I was trying to ask her a question I stopped and asked if she was in a rush because I felt rushed. We had just walked 4 miles to get to the place because my 8 year old daughter wanted pasta with butter. So we trekked to find it. When we did find it we were relieved,and didn't know what we were in for. We are on a family vacation or I would have spent 1.29 to boil my own spaghetti to feed three kids at home instead of wasting $58. My veggie burger was ok except for the ton of seasoning salt that she probably told the cook to pour on it because I asked her if she was in a rush. Good thing I caught it before I ate it and I had to wipe it off with my napkin. I should have asked for a manager but I decided to be quiet and not get my girls upset because they were starving. Again , waste of money and never been treated so horribly before at a sports bar! Oh and drinks were filled right before she gave us the check I had to drink from my kids drink. The one star was for the sweet potato fries. 
Deeply regret going there. Actually am upset my kids were present to see it. I have terrible heartburn also.

I had buffalo wings and a side cesear salad.  The food was fine.  Nothing special.  Not too overpriced considering it is located on the strip.

I was told that they do not serve tap water (only bottled) so I was forced into purchasing a soda.

The service was horrible.  There were about 30 people dining and only one waitress.  The other waitresses were on break or hadn't started their shift.  I could see them sitting around texting on their phones while I got bad service.

They turned on the audio to some basketball game.  It was way too loud.  I had to scream to my friend sitting accross the table.

The food is 3 stars.  The service is 1 star.  Averages to 2 stars.
Good spot for starting the day early with a boozy brunch. Our bartender was Belle and she was awesome.

Daniel (manager) wouldn't stand behind his "product / advertisement" as he denied us the bucket of "domestic beer" for $25 (Miller Lite / Coors Light), outstanding service provided by our server (Kimberly). Wings were good, drinks not so much.

Shopping our way around the Miracle Mile shops this was a likely pit stop to "refuel" since it's the halfway point for the mall.  Seating is available inside or on the "mall patio".  Bartenders were very friendly and service was prompt.  Prices weren't too bad and they have more than enough tv's to cover every game you might want to watch.  I'd stop here again for a drink and maybe an appetizer next time thru.

Came here for a drink the other night and had a great experience. Great sports bar located in the Planet Hollywood hotel. The bartender that night, Belle, was amazing. She was very attentive and the drinks were made really well. Great place to watch pretty much any game going on while having a good drink and great service. Stop by if you're in town!

EHHH...

My friends came to Vegas and wanted to try this place out because they had coupons for it. I expected it to be blah, since I checked the reviews of the place before hand. I ordered their chicken sandwich, which was grilled (and BURNT AND REALLY TOUGH/HARD ON THE ENDS OF THE BREASTS!) Oh my gosh! It made me full though, since I didn't eat anything that morning and afternoon. The only thing I ate good here was the curly fries (and the honey mustard...and definitely the dill pickle....and my unsweetened ice tea)

Oh btw.......you have to buy a small water bottle here...which is a $1...and they give you a cup with ice....

There is a happy hour from 4-6pm...$10 all you can drink Bud, I believe....They also have this HUGE pitcher of beer which is great for a group of friends...(forgot the price, but it's very affordable!) You can also play beer pong here too!

The waitresses were dressed in skimpy cheerleading outfits, which many were not very tasteful in. Don't eat outside unless you want to hear a load of noise during your meals, since it's right across from that performing arts stage with acrobats! It's a bit quieter inside, even if the sports games are on. It could get very LOUD though when there's a big game!

This place is amazing!! Wonderful atmosphere, amazing drink specials and some great food! I will recommend this place to many friends! I will be sure to go back when i want to meet some cool people or just have a few beers and watch the games!!

Having been given a $25 coupon to the Miracle Mile Mall restaurant (located within Planet Hollywood's shopping center), my husband and I went here looking for a filling yet fun dinner. The wait staff lives up to the Blondie's logo - female only waitresses sporting XXS cheerleader outfits, snug enough to showcase their tan stomachs and a hint of their bottoms. Forcing the feminist in me to get over the use of costuming and gendered employee selections (this is Vegas, after all), we made friends with our waitress, a Brazilian woman, and ordered water and sweet potato fries for starters, only to find out that the restaurant does not supply water but does sell bottles for $1 each. Typical Vegas nickel-and-dime tactic. The sweet potato fries were served with powered sugar on top and a side of honey - absolutely and unexpectedly delicious (the unexpected part based on the college-sport theme of the restaurant the constant advertisements for $10 all you can drink buckets of Miller). My husband ordered a Philly Chicken Cheese sandwhich, which was tasty yet quite processed and dry. My spinach, raspberry, and blue cheese salad was abundant in size and delicious, with plenty left over. Our choice of dessert was fulfilling: a rich brownie with ice cream and walnuts. 
Hoping for a pleasant reprise, we returned to Blondie's the next week to redeem another restaurants.com coupon. To our dismay we saw a sign on the hostess station posting that the restaurant no longer accepts restaurant.com coupons, and when asked why, the manager gave us no reason. They offered us a 25% discount in trade, which would not even be worth it considering they charge just for water. 
Go to Blondie's if: You are dying to see your college team flag sported somewhere in Vegas; if you want some good sweet potato fries - only; if you want some cheap happy-hour beer deals; if you are more interested in foreign 20-something waitresses in skin tight, butt-cheek-revealing cheerleader uniforms. 
Don't go to Blondie's if: You want a good deal; if patriarchal marketing tactics offend you (though this IS Vegas...); you have kids with you; you want superb food at a superb price. And finally - don't go if you have a restaurant.com coupon! Jamnit!

It was good. Breakfast special was all week ... Heck yea? So we had the specials Bloody Mary and bud light and $3.99 and the omelet. Someone  asked to take our photo we never got it... Though . Kinda upsetting

Going to Vegas tonight and was thinking about this bar.  I came here a few years ago for a Paquiao fight.  I remember the $60? entrance fee which included unlimited bud/bud light.  We had some chicken wings and the one that was the best I had in a while was the habanero flavor.  It was pretty spicy for someone like me that like spicy and it had a great crunch.  But yeah I thought those were some of the best wings I've had.

I forgot the name of this bar in the beginning so decided to find it on yelp and to see such low reviews.  I was thinking to stopby for those spicy wings again.
If you want sports, this is THE place!!! Whether it's football, baseball, soccer, UFC...they have it all on BIG screens. Great food and drinks!! Great staff!!!

Sadly, ESPN zone doesn't exist anymore (I LOVE ESPN Zone very, very much) at the New York New York, so we went here. 

It did fine, but it buried deep in Planet Hollywood, and not close to the outside. People watching was on the low and the waitress wasn't too alert to us. I had wings and a Coors, he had a chicken sandwich and long islands. Remember, it was barely noon. I'd probably find a place that was closer to the outside. I wanted sunshine and warmth.

There is a eaten chicken wing at the table I was seated at. Um? I assume the staff didnt care about the cleaning of this table before seating us. With that being said, have a nice day lol. Never coming here again. Adios.

I went here like a year ago. Service was great. personally i love being around good looking blondes so that was a plus. I had the Fried Ravioli.. They were Perfectly fried and Im going back this month can't wait to go and try some other things on there menu...

Meh.  It was ok.  Burger doesn't come with fries and was $15!  Salad was big.  Pizza took a while but they explained it would take longer because they made it on-site.  Good to know that - I'd hate to have them get it from another place.  The employees didn't really seem too interested in their job.  I know they see lot of tourists but it says a lot about the business when they are talking to you and looking somewhere else.    The guy in the back I had to ask for a bag for my leftovers was very nice.  He's probably the only reason it got 2 stars.
I was there Saturday May 26th and got what i think was E coli virus from a salad. I would be careful when ordering, staff was nice.

Waitress Heidi super nice. However, the food was just soooo BAD everything.  The ice tea was like water....spoiled milk, buffalo chicken wrap was almost like a dog food!!! Don't know why this restaurant still in business. First ever review so unhappy! Have to be drunk to eat there never again!!!

We were in need of some mid morning beers while walking through the miracle mile shops and stopped in at Blondies - the place was pretty empty so we snagged a table outside for some ample people watching. They have $20 all you can drink beer but we just settled for pitchers. Their beer selection was pretty disappointing for a sports place but luckily they had preseason NFL games to keep us occupied. Inside of the restaurant reminds you of a dirty 'ol college bar so I'd recommend sitting outside, unless you like the whole frat house beer stains everywhere thing.

We went by during lunch because we saw a sign for wings. Neither of us ended up getting wings. I got the big bowl of pasta for $3.75 and my husband had a grilled cheese. The spaghetti was pretty decent actually and came with two huge pieces of garlic bread. Grilled cheese left a little to be desired. Service was great though!
Decent sports bar, but overpriced, 4 beers and nachos $90.

Bad bar food, poor service and defiantly only for people who want to play beer games. I would have been ok with the "bar" atmosphere (since it is a Sports BAR) if the food wasn't gross and service wasn't bad. I wont ever go back.

Terrible experience.  First of all there was only one blonde waitress in the whole place, they are out of Bud and Bud Light, slow service and our waitress was not the friendliest.  I ordered the nachos and it had a nice amount of chips but only enough toppings for a quarter of the chips.  My wife asked for a lemons for her water and the waitress brought out one lemon slice.  I ordered a beer and the waitress brought the wrong one out so I had to wait for the correct one to be brought out, after waiting 10 minutes for the first one.  NOT HAPPY.

Worse service ever! My wife and I stop by for dinner after a long drive up to LV. Since we were staying at HP we decided to eat close. We sat down at 6:50pm, the waitress never came by till I flagged her down. At around 7:40, I asked her about our food, she leaves then come back and tells us that she forgot to enter my wife's meal and says it will be right up. Tic Toc, Tic Toc, at 8:28 the food comes. The food was nice and hot, not bad, but not worth the wait. When the bill comes she leave it on the table and walks away, not a word! I open it and she over charged us for a extra drink, chips and salsa which we never had or ordered. 

The staff is a bunch of young kids, they were more busy texting than helping out the paying customer!

Stay far away!!!
Good service and fun atmosphere. Katherine was friendly and attentive (+1 for her). We both had salads which were huge, oriental for me and Caesar for her.

If you're a sports fan, then this is the place to go. They serve typical bar food that isn't the greatest. 
The grilled cheese with bacon wasn't anything spectacular. It was pretty bland.. Who thought  you could go wrong with a grilled cheese? 
The waitress was very nice and the atmosphere was good

Not the highlight of my Vegas trip.. The waitresses are dressed in high school cheerleader outfits but their attitudes were shitty.. Like they were pissed that they had to dress in stupid uniforms and serve us.. hello, you applied for the job, no one put a gun to your head. The prices are expensive for normal, boring American fare, the waitresses are not sexy, pretty or charming and the food was just OK.. I like sport bars so it is hard for me to give only 2 stars, but in this case I will.

5 stars only cause my server Marissa was outstanding, she really knew her menu & had plenty of  recommendations of what drink to get from the bar :) I will defiantly be coming back because of her & the potato fries !

I was pleasantly surprised last night at Blondies. I was strolling through Planet Hollywood shops & playing a little at the Casino. Wanted to have a quick bite, nothing to big & decided to stop by. It was during the week so the crowd was light. I really liked the sports bar. There was flat screens everywhere of course. The appetizers were awesome full of flavor, I ordered a chicken Cobb salad & that was delicious. They give you your monies worth. The waitress was attentive, although they did seem short of staff (but that could of been because it was a weekday). I also had a great Frozen Strawberry Margarita or 2 haha! I usually don't like margaritas but the waitress recommended it & I was impressed. You can actually taste the liquor. It didn't take like a Slurpee from 7Eleven w/cheap liquor. The bill was decent, nevertheless the waitress got a nice tip &  I will definitely be going back when I'm at Planet Hollywood.

We stopped in here to get a burger but never ate. The hostess was not there to seat us and waited awhile to be seated and after being seated we sat there for almost ten minutes before someone finally came to wait on us. After the 10 minutes of waiting we realized the menu sucked as well. So we just opted for the bucket of beers. And guess what it says 5 for 25 and then we were told that was the wrong price too and it cost more and they are aluminum bottles fyi. I can't say much about this place. Also another FYI make note that they have a hidden charge for using your card and not cash. It is on an itsy bitsy little sign on the front of the hostess table.

This is the place I go to for beer pong! Thursday night tournaments is where it's at! Whether it's a weekend or week night this place has a crowd. It's a great place to pre-game. The staff is great & so much fun! They have improved the look of the place, by adding a ton of tvs. The food is always good, try the chicken strips, & the bar is always full! Beer pong is $5 for setup & the cost of the pitcher. They have about 8-10 beer pong tables depending on the night. It's only a handful places left in Vegas that offer beer pong nightly. I highly recommned Blondie's as your official pre-game place! If you're looking to watch a game/s & NOT be at a sports book, this is one of the top 3 places on the strip you'll want to consider.

My family was welcomed by a server named Ashely who took care of us. From entering and leaving our lunch was great & we were well taken care of,  Because of Ashelys service, we will be back the next time we visit vegas. Thank you Ashley !!

If our service had been better I would have given a 3 star review, but that was by far one of the worst parts of the meal!

Drinks are overpriced and WAY under-poured! $9 for a glass of Chardonnay in a sports bar is a freaking ripoff!! 

Everyone at our table is in the food service industry, and it's why we went there as we had credit to use. 

The food is your typical Sysco spread of wraps, sandwiches, and msg coated curly fries! The only stand out was the Cobb salad but at almost $15 it was a ripoff also! 

We will not be back, and I honestly would suggest to not dine here unless you are in it for their all you can drink program! Such a let down!
Great service! Great food! I think you should check it out!!

This was not a pleasant experience.  I went in one afternoon during the NHL Finals and set at the bar.  The bar was completely full, yet there was only one bartender.  He was nice, but obviously not super attentive.  I didn't even attempt to order food because I was afraid I'd end up wasting my whole day there.  And it seemed to me the place wasn't very clean.

Given the theme, I was expecting a more upbeat atmosphere.  If I give them another shot, I'll be particular about when I go.  Overall, I'd recommend walking a little further down to Twin Peaks... it's all-around better.
If you want overpriced garbage go here I paid $45 for a pizza and 12 wings I guess they expect you to win the money in the casino so you have some to throw away at this dump

Went to Blondies on 12-28 to watch the Lions/Packers while visiting Vegas. Bad decision. Food is way over priced, service is bad and the beer prices are $$$! The Lions/Packers game was the featured game yet at the start, they had music blaring so loud and no game sound. They tuned in the game on several Tvs but they were not synced. Several of our food orders were cold. A much better option is the Mexican Cantina across the mall!

We arrived today and decided to stop in for the all you can drink for $20 happy hour. I'm not sure why some people have reviewed poorly but my guess is they didn't get our AMAZING server Taylor!  Not only was she super attentive but she was so personable and pleasant. I would recommend this to anyone!! Our drinks were super strong and we left a great experience overall. Drinks and hot wings...you can't go wrong!
Blondie's is such a fun place to kick it! Pizza is AMAZING! Nick and Niall are hilarious and so fun!

Good place to watch the game but nothing else. Lots of TVs around. The food is whatever's. It is bar food. The garlic fries were super greasy. The chili cheese fries tasted good. And they use cheese whiz. The Philly cheese steak lacked flavor. Burgers/sandwiches are about $16 each and don't even come with fries. It's super expensive here.
This was a waste......... over priced!!!! my burger was burnt the service was worse don't go here no manager around no one checking to see if everything is ok. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Being from Chicago this bar reminds me of two from home.  They are a bar.  They have TVs.  They get you drunk.  I have now been here 3 times and will keep coming on every trip.  First trip we were all 21 and they had a $10 bud light and beer pong wristband.  We got drunk.  Second trip i'm 26 with all of my cousins and aunts and uncles they have a $20 wristband we all get wasted.  We sat at a table the waitress never came so we ordered from the bar and got wasted.  We had a great time and the next morning we had to piece together the night.  3rd trip out there during football sat at the bar and had a bartender / barback named g being really cool with us.
