He even gave me a jameson bottle opener from a promo they had.  We are planning a trip for the end of September and plan on going there at least once.   EVERYONE LISTEN HERE IF YOU TIP WELL THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU.  YOU WILL NEVER HAVE TO WAIT.

Came here for the UFC Fight on Saturday night.  Bought tickets for a table for 6 knowing only two were going to come for sure.  $40 to get in and ALL you can drink draft beer is SWEET!  Actually worked out cool finding 4 random people to watch the fight with.  Definitely will be going there for the next UFC Fight, $40 will get you 5 bud light bottles elsewhere.  The staff was cool with how busy it was and I had some Jalapeno poppers that were great!  A fun spot inside Planet Hollywood in the Miracle Miles shops.  Check it out, fun place and good food!

2 1/2 stars?? 

Everyone musta missed the 20$ open bar happy hour. the wings aren't bad either. of course the bartender lags upon flashing your wristband. get everyone to kick in some cash and throw the bartender a decent tip, like anywhere in vegas,  they'll definitely keep the rounds coming. they also have beer pong tables, if you're into that kinda thing.

definitely a good place to kick off friday night in sin city.
We tried Blondies for the first time and the food was terrible. Spinach artichoke dip and burgers were very greasy.  The server was very friendly but we will not return.

Loved this cute little sports bar inside Planet Hollywood! Brandon was our bartender, he was super fun, quick with our drink orders and very attentive!!! Food was surprisingly awesome here too! Highly recommend this bar!
Fabulous weekday breakfast special. Way better than the Salsa place across from it. Will eat here everyday when I go back. Kudos and don't change your prices.

So, my husband and I were hungry and just wanted something close by where we were staying, so we decided to try Blondies. 

We ordered the regular size pepperoni pizza. I asked for a water and they waitress stated they only have bottled water!  I will never pay more than $1 for bottled water, so I ordered a soda. 

The pizza was good. Our waitress sucked. My husband never got a refill on his drink and the cup sat there empty.

When the receipt came I was so angry to see a soda cost $4!!! Really?! So $30 was the total for a pizza for two and two sodas! 

I would never come back here.

Went here for breakfast based on an article about cheap Vegas breakfasts.

OMG!!! Was so good, went back the next day.

Breakfast burrito was excellent...and so big I couldn't finish.  My only complaint was no decaf coffee. Oerwise, I highly recommend.

We didn't eat food at Blondies because it's a rather sub-par version of a sports bar.  We sat on the patio which looks out to the mall.  We met a group of friends there as they were finishing up their mediocre bar food.  We sat at a tall patio table but were never acknowledged by the waitress.  Instead, she walked passed us many times but never made eye contact.
I went up to the bar to order a beer and to grab waters for our table.  The bartender was friendly but he informed me that there is a minimum if you want to pay with a credit card.  Luckily I had cash to pay for my beer.
I'm giving two stars instead of one, simply because the bartender was nice.
Overall, a crappy experience.  I wouldn't go back.

We LOVE this place!! My boyfriend & I originally went in April of 2012 because I found a deal on Living Social for Blondies. We were so impressed with it that we bought another Living Social deal and brought our friends on Sunday March 24th.

It was packed due to a pub crawl, and I wasn't expecting to get very good service simply due to the massive amount of people. I was so wrong - Silvia was our server & I can honestly say she's one of the best servers I've ever had, anywhere. We all LOVED her!! I can't recommend this place enough & if you choose to go, ask for Silvia!!
the food was just average, i'm gonna play beer pong next time, our server was hot
Decent food, but slow service during happy hour! Our server told us "we could go to the bar and get our own drinks".

We had a large group attend the Super Bowl at Blondies. We had a great time. The draft beer selection was lacking but the bottle service was awesome. The bar drinks were even better, big pours with more on the way! The food was good. The service depended on who your server was, ours was great. 

As far as a place to go to watch a UFC event or big game? You can't beat it. Dozens of big HD TVs every where. We will be back neck year for sure. 

If I had one complaint it would be the restroom. There are not enough men's facilities and they need a cleaning during big events.

The food and drinks were fine, pizza was really good. Our server seemed a little flighty. I ask to see the drink menu because I wanted a mixed drink. She handed me the list then walked away. She may have been giving me time to look it over but a little communication that she would be right back would have been nice. Tons of TV but audio for only one game.
My choice for the grilled chicken was ok, but very small portion. my friends were suffering from their food choices. I didn't like their food, also it's overpriced.
Great place to catch the games! Ashley P took great care of us both times we were in! Definitely coming back!

Worst place ever! Came in on Friday night. Hostess nowhere to be found. The bartender was touching and grabbing on the other bartender the entire time there. 5 people working and one actually working. The wings were horrible. Just bad. No flavor. The silverware was wrapped but was crusty and not cleaned. I will never ever go back.

19.99 All You Can Drink AYCD! Came here this past weekend got to watch the USMNT vs Jamaica game and it was great. Happy hour was perfect had a ton of beers and a ton of well drinks, the waitress we had was pretty on point brought me drinks before I could even ask for any. 

The only problem was we sat on the outside and the TV wall had the lines through it so I couldn't get a cohesive picture, other than that it was a blast.
Great place to watch sports on the strip and the food is not your regular bar food. Fernanda was my server and was very attentive.

We went here for the Cotto vs. Martinez fight, got here an hour early and the place was packed. The man at the front entrance stated the fight was going to be displayed on the outside entrance of the bar, we waited on the outside for awhile, we were lucky enough to grab two seats, the two male bartenders were un-attentive, couldn't get a drink.

The black male at the front entrance later made an announcement the fight was going to be displayed on the inside of the bar, and since the demand to watch the fight was so high they were going to start charging everyone there to watch the fight, complete bullshit, they advertised online that the fight was free, we called in to double-check the fight was free, when we got there we informed the man at the front entrance we were there to watch the fight, he let us in then 30 minutes later tried to charge us? After we argued he said we were fine, that we were grandfathered in since we were there before they decided to start charging people.

Now we were upset because we wasted 30 minutes outside of the bar to find a seat, when we could have been inside waiting for a seat. When we called earlier they said they didn't take reservations, when we proceeded to the inside of the bar there were 3 tables reserved, no one sitting at them to watch the fight.

Once again we were lucky enough to find seats on the inside at a table of 4 with only 2 guys sitting there, they were nice enough to let us share the table.

Our waitress is the only reason there is 2 stars, I'm not sure of her name, but she was very nice, very understanding, and decently attentive for how packed the place was.

The food, we got a Chicken Caesar Wrap and a side of fries, the wrap was full of lettuce and very little chicken, I got 2 quarter sized pieces on my half, we assumed the chicken would be grilled as most are and instead it was deep fried. The fries were very soggy and greasy, they weren't bad though. The price on the menu for the wrap was $13 and some change, we got billed $16 alone for it and some change plus tax. Menu error? Waitress error? 2 Touch Pos system error? Who knows.

Now right before the main fight starts, a waitress comes to our table and places a reserve sign on our table without saying a thing and walks away. We yelled to get her attention, she came back and said our table will be reserved for the fight, we said we were watching the fight, she told us we would have to pay for the table PLUS have to pay to watch the fight. COMPLETE BULLSHIT, I don't know who manages this place but you don't advertise a free fight on the internet, you don't tell people over the phone the fight at your bar is free and that you aren't taking reservations and then decide to change your mind, to charge people for the fight, to charge people for tables, and start taking reservations because the demand is high  to watch the fight, unbelievable. 

After arguing with the lady and telling her who we talked to and what they said, she went to confirm with him, came back and said we were fine. Not one person in this bar knew what the hell was going on, completely disorganized and chaotic. 

While watching the fight a man that was very intoxicated fell and hit his head on my barstool, he could have injured himself very badly, I'm not sure who his waitress was, but it was her job to cut him off long before he got to that point, after he fell and hit his head, he couldn't stand up on his own a friend had to help him, even after that, he still didn't get cutoff. If this place continues this type of service they will lose their liquor license.

The only reason I would come back here is because our waitress was so nice, other then that management needs to get their sh*t together, that's not how you run a sports bar.
The worst place we ate at for breakfast. Coffee was terrible, toast was hard and the bacon was terrible. The service was also pretty slow. Keep walking and try the la salsa Cantina for breakfast.

Summary: This is a great place if you want to watch a game/sports and drink loads of cheap beer while eating some (to my surprise) pretty good bar food. Since I don't drink - sadly the cheap / all you can drink beer was a waste on me. I'd bring a crew here for sure.

I went to Blondies to view the UFC fights (Go John Jones!) - cover was a bit overpriced $40! BUT I forgive that for the cheap beer - again, wasted on me - but I can see how paying $40 cover + $20 = damn good night for some folks. 

Atmosphere: What you'd expect from a sports bar - loads of TVs, etc. If you have a big group you can "buy" a big booth with primo viewing to the screens, if youre a small group or solo - there's plenty of seating available.  The people in this place range wildly - you are in Vegas. I found mostly friendly sports-watching-having-a-good-time people. 

Food: HEARTY portions, and surprisingly pretty good. I had a BLT and shared some onion rings, both of which were not greasy and overdone - but tasted fresh. Even the toasted bread on my sandwich was fresh. 

Service: Decent. I was happy that the girls in cheerleader uniforms weren't so boob-a-licious that it was annoying. They were cute and friendly, and bless them for having to run around with pitchers of beer serving half distracted sports watchers. They were fast, I didn't wait forever, and there was enough of them that i never had to flag one down.

Overall - better than Buffalo Wild Wings for a little in-hotel Vegas sports action.
Cheap $3.99 breakfast mon-fri if your on a budget or don't want to spend much. It's inside the mall by the box office.

Hmm, well it's relatively affordable as far as Vegas goes. And they have a lot of TV's. There was room to sit here as opposed to PH's sports-book bar that was packed to the brim. The 'famous' chicken wings were anything but. I feel bad for the midget chickens that these came from. The chili fries were okay. I'd go back in a pinch, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

You could do worse than this place to chug cheap brews, play beer pong, do jagermeister shots and watch a game.  The atmosphere is almost like a supped up Brother Jimmy's NYC. 

Happy hour for $20 from 3-6pm includes all you can drink well drinks and beer which is a very reasonable way to kick off an evening or destroy the rest of your day.  I guess that depends on you.  I haven't tried the food but it looks like I shouldn't based on a lot of the reviews.  

I'm just as bad at beer pong now as I was in my late teens (if not worse) but it's still fun.

I am not liking this place but to watch the game here would be cool as they have tons of TV's everywhere...and super loud! I barely could hear the group that went with me here! 

This was located in the Miracle miles shops. It's a sport bar kind of place. The ladies here wear cheerleader type outfits that show a lot of cleavage and I am sure the men that go here love that. Service was pretty good thou. ;p

The bench seats were pretty cool but the food is only ok. We ordered their traditional wings. It was deep fried but they over soaked it with the sauce that made the chicken soggy. We ordered their nachos with all the fixings but it cost over $21! Was not worth it as it was flavorless or nothing special about it. We ordered the $3.99 all you can eat pasta. There is a choice of fettuccine Alfredo or spaghetti. It came with garlic bread but it was kinda soggy thou. I think the past was pretty good for the price due to size.

Bathrooms were kinda nasty. They need to really clean it. Sorry but I won't be coming back!

I'm not sure I understand all the hate for this place.  It has everything you'd want from a sports bar.  There are tons of TVs with easy viewing from every angle.  The TVs are crisp and clear and sound is good too.  Service has been stellar and superfast.  Beer is cold and reasonably priced.   If you go in expecting food better than bar food, you'll be disappointed.  But it isn't that bad for bar food.  Overall a big thumbs up for Blondies.

The food was bad and over priced.  The waitress was slow and not helpful.  She couldn't even think of anything to suggest we get when asked.  Also, she served me a beer that was only 3/4 full and charged me $5 bucks for those 6ozs of bud light.  
The bartender single handily ruined the night for the group with rude comments and D bag behavior.  At one point he called out some people in our group over the PA system to stop cheering about the beer pong tournament because they were annoying. This caused a few of them to be insulted.  They were not out of control or anything... just gave a woot to our friends who were playing.  
But hey no worries, Mr. Bartender,  I'll never suggest to any of my out of town guests, who are looking for some fun, to spend any of their money at Blondies.

Came here to watch a UFC fight and had several problems:

1) Bait & Switch: Advertised price was $40 cover charge to get all you can drink beer. Upon arriving found out that all you can drink special didn't start until after preliminary fights were over 2 hours later.

2) Packed: Are there fire laws in Vegas? They packed so many people into that small space. Everyone was standing shoulder to shoulder.

3) All you can drink = 2 beers: There were so many people that once the "all you can drink" special started it was almost impossible to get a beer. There was no way to get to the bar and the waitresses serving beer were mobbed by the people around the bar so people in the back could not get a drink. By the end of the night we were only able to get 2 beers each out of the "all you can drink" special. 

4) No security: As the evening progressed a group of fans became more and more rowdy. There was no security presence. At the end of the fight they began jumping on chairs, shoving and falling on other guests. Nothing was done to stop them or protect the other guests. 

This place may be nice at other times, but I do not recommend coming here to see an event.
Dont waste your time or money.  Poor service, food quality horrible..but gave it a star for very cold beer and clear flat screens.

Came here while strolling thru the Miracle Mile Shops. I was pretty hungry and didn't want to wait or blow a wad of money, so burgers came up. This place looked fun with the sports bar theme and TVs playing video clips. The outside (in the mall) seating was high bar tables and regular tables in the middle. 

Our server Belle, came over quickly and got us waters. She was great. She offered us some suggestions and was always available when we had a question. I went with the burger as I was craving one. I was really expecting overpriced mediocre bar food, but was surprised by the burger I got. It was really good! Just a cheese burger with bacon, pepper jack cheese, and jalapenos - well done. It was served on a buttery brioche bun with all the usual veggies. It was greasy but that's what I wanted - wasn't looking for health food here. The burger was flavorful and a good sized patty. I did finish. Paired it with a Shocktop brew and was sittin pretty. 

Saw another table serve up a huge pitcher of beer with a spout on it. Next time..next time... haha. Food was good, filling and didn't break the bank. I have plenty of other places to do that in Vegas. Vibe was fun with the cheerleader waitresses and music playing. Definitely worh a look for your sports bar / burger spot in the mall.

I do not understand why the rating on this bar is so poor!  The service was amazing when I was there never going long without being checked on.  Our food was very tasty as well!  There was a very good selection of beer on tap to keep you from getting thirsty too.  I recommend the "shock top" beer as it is one of the more tasty American beers that I have ever tasted.  When I can find it back home I pick it up too.  
Even during US college football playoffs of some kind I was able to watch the Outdoor Classic hockey game with a bunch of other hockey fans around one of their many big screens.  I highly recommend this sports bar!  The waitress's outfits don't hurt the eyes either!

You are even able to watch the fountain show across the way as well from the seats on the outside of the bar proper and that is quite interesting as well.

We wanted to catch a quick bite before the 8:30pm variety show in the miracle mile shops. Such a nice surprise in an overpriced shopping mall!

Food: We sat at the bar. I ordered a side salad, potato skins and hubby ordered 1 dozen of barbecue wings. He said the wings are good. My potato skins are the best I have ever had! because they are super crunchy outside and soft inside, topped with crispy bacon and scallions. They taste like deep-fried baked potato. The best part is that the sour cream came on the side, so the crispy potato skin did not get soggy. Also they put the salad dressing on the side without me asking, so you can decide how much you want. 

Atmosphere: Tons of different large TVs with more channels than I can watch. I am not a sports fan but I was thoroughly entertained. 

Service: The bartender did warn us that the potato skins would take 15 minutes to make, because they are made to order. He is exactly right with the waiting time! Attentive

If you're in Las Vegas, you HAVE to stop by Blondies.  The place is always packed with a fun group of people.  Everyone gets really into the games, which are playing all over because they have tv screens everywhere.  

If you stop by, CHECK IN!  You get a free drink if you check in on Yelp.  They also have a ton of really great mixed drinks.

Even if you aren't a sports fan, you'll like this place.  Their menu has a lot of variety, so it's easy to find something you'll like.  (I hard a hard time picking my meal because there were so many great looking options.   Also, (especially for downtown Las Vegas), they have really reasonable prices.  

Overall, the food is great, the drinks are even better, the atmosphere is fun, and the location (on the Strip) is perfect.

Quick summary: poor and disrespectful bar management. Everything else (food) etc cannot comment on, but having a manager disrespect our whole group was enough to think this place is not worth it. Please read to avoid a similar horrible experience. 

Had a beyond horrible experience here. Came to watch an NCAA game this past Saturday with a group of 5. We got there and the service was horrible. We basically served ourselves by going to the bar to get drinks. The waitress didn't start paying attention to us until she realized we were ordering a lot of drinks and would have a big bill. 
Here comes the fun part! Someone on my team got hurt and was on the floor. The opposing team's fans at the bar yelled stay down to a kid! So of course I said that's rude and they proceeded to start a chant calling me an "ahole". Fine I let that one go. Towards the end of the game when the other team clearly was about to win the same fans started the "ahole" chant again for no reason. So I asked the manager if he was going to let that happen at his bar and he said "this is a sports game, get over it." I said ok I understand that but are you still going to accept this kind of behavior and bad environment at your bar? And he said yes. So I left the bar. My friends went to go talk to him and he said rudely "you don't talk, I'm talking." Who says that as a manager? His demeanor in handling this situation was rude and demeaning.  I get that it's a sports game, but he should not one that kind of environment at his bar or treated customers that way. I don't know what his problem is but I did complain to upper management and I hope they will handle the situation accordingly. 
Upper management was very gracious when I told them my situation and I appreciated that. As for bar management HORRIBLE! I don't know how he got this gig as a manager.  As an FYI it was an older man that was the manager on duty for this instance. He could care less about customers and only cared about himself.  No respect for other human beings what so ever. 
So if you want to watch sports somewhere where they actually care and respect you as a customer, do not go here. I'm sorry to say this after speaking to upper management but other customers deserve to know what a bad environment this is.

I don't mind paying high prices in Vegas for good food, but this is a let down.  Terrible bar food, using no fresh ingredients.  After trying 3 different items there (Ruben, sliders, and cheese steak) it's time to throw in the towel.  I won't go back.  Service was average, but not what you expect in Las Vegas, a city that operates on service.

If this place depended on repeat business they wouldn't make it long.

Sat at the bar to watch the game. Wings were good. The margarita machine was terrible. Thought it tasted like a dirty machine. Tried the rocks version, worse. Stick to draft of mixed drinks and you will be fine.

We came here during a football game.  They had great music going during the commercials and a great vibe going on.  

When we walked up, we told the girl we needed a table for two.  She said, sorry, we don't have any tables.  Okay, then can we get on a list?  She says, "I guess so!  With the game on, I just don't know if anyone is going to leave soon."  (She didn't really seem to want us there).  Another girl walks up and says, "oh, there is a table right here."  Another girl says, "No, that's for another party."  So we give them our name and walk towards the bar.  Before we make it to the bar, a waitress comes back and says that we can have that table because the other party doesn't want it.  Geesh people, make up your mind!

We ordered two frozen drinks that were a special.  Something black cherry.  They came from a machine on the wall.  They were SUPER frozen.  After letting it thaw out, we finally gave it a taste and YUCK!!!  It tasted like cough syrup.  I guess maybe we should have sent it back but they were only $3, so we sucked it up and each drank about 1/2 of our little glass in the hour that we were there.

I ordered the roast beef sandwich and fries.  My friend got the grilled chicken wrap.  They were both okay.  Nothing special.  The fries were just average.  The waitress we got was actually really nice, so we can't knock her.  She initially charged us $5 each for our drinks but then changed it when asked.

After catching a show at the nearby V Theater, wandered over to Blondies when it was still located in the Aladdin Resort & Casino name.  It was probably a Tuesday, and that meant all you can drink beer and well drinks for $10.  

Walking into the back, tables of beer pong were in full action and it reminded me of fraternities gone wild.  There were even girls making out for the mere sake of making out in Vegas and having guys gawk at you.  (It wasn't even that late yet and the girls were far from drunk!)  

Bartenders were less than friendly, probably because they aren't making any tips during all you can drink beer nights.  And with that crappy attitude, what's the point?  

It's a bit of pain, they won't even let you in to eat or watch the games on the television without paying the $10 up front.  So, that part sucks alone.  They make you wear one of those bracelets anyway saying that you paid for all you can drink, so why not let other people in to eat?  

I personally wouldn't bother returning. I'm not interested in revisiting college frat life.  But if that' what you're looking for or am missing, swing on by!  You'll fit right in with your Greek letters.

They apparently have a happy hour here too.

Went on a Sunday.. Only to watch football.. The service started off pretty Rocky, but got a bit better with time and with more alcohol. The food was ok, then again, I was loaded. The waitresses are barely outta diapers and run around lost half the time. Nothing to brag about.

Only reason I'm even giving it 2 stars is because the food was decent.. Service not so much. And when you go to pay they tell you it's a "minimum" 25 dollars if your using multiple credit cards when that little fact is clearly not stated ANYWHERE. She tried to say it charges the house if it's under 25 dollars. Either management is completely stupid or the owners a penny pincher, either way I've never had that happen before and def won't be back again.

Two stars is being generous. Slow service, average food at best, and high prices.

Ordered fish and chips and the fish was cooked using grease that had not been changed in several days. 

Beer menu is severely limited with only one or two decent beers not made by Budweiser. Ordered Alaskan Amber. Over 10 minutes later, the waitress reappeared to inform me that they were in fact out of Alaskan Amber, which they only have in bottles in the first place.

Too many other good options at Planet Hollywood. Scratch this option.
This place should be called beer pong bar because that's all there is.  Well, plus some to small 40 inch tvs so far away they can't easily be seen. Wont go back.

A bustling sports bar with every fried food under the sun, and every game imaginable playing.  Tons of beer and liquor. I wouldn't eat here if I wasn't with 7 other mid-30s guys wanting to drink and watch games.  But that was my crowd, and Blondie's served a good purpose.   Doubtful I will ever visit here again...

Nice bar in Planet Hollywood but drink prices are thru the roof. Drink card on table does not post prices. For example 12 ounce bottle Bud Light was $6.00. One of their signature drinks posted on the card was $15.00 and only about 6 ounces in a very small martini glass.

Absolutely terrible. I came here to watch a game, and legitimately they have a million TVs which is nice. I ordered nachos which were 30 dollars after I added chicken, guac, sour cream, and Jalapeños, all things that should automatically come with nachos. The nachos were a pile of broken store bought chips covered in that terrible liquid cheese you pump onto chips at a movie theater. The chicken was some weird unseasoned ground flavorless stuff. The guac was also store bought, and the jalapeños came on the side instead of being in the nachos.
Then since it's in the middle of the building there isn't much reception so I try to log onto the WiFi. It says you can do it if you check in on facebook or if you have a password. I asked for the password and they said they wouldn't give it to me, that I had to check in on facebook. I'll be damned if I'm going to advertise for them after such terrible food. I guess the 30 bucks I paid for nachos wasn't enough for a WiFi password. F this place.

Went here for Sunday football.

We had to put 200$ down the reserve a table. No big deal because with 8 of us we spent that much and they took it off the bill. Only thing was that it made it challenging to pay the bill because everyone neede cash.

At first things weren't going well because we had to wait 20 mins for the party before us to leave. (Their game went into ot) then it took 20 for our waitress to come by. But from there we were good.

Food was ok.

Prices were ok.

Our waitress was great. (Kristen of rhs fame)

Probably would go back but was ok.

Great for all-around sports fanatics and even for the not-so-big sports people.
Whether if you're a die hard fan or just a simple casual fan who's supporting your friends/family/significant others team, this restaurant have great atmosphere. 

One of the few drawbacks with Blondies is if you have your heart set to watch the game here, you would need to make reservations pretty far in advance. You can do that by either calling the restaurant or make a reservation through their website. With walk-ins, it's pretty much the luck of the draw. If there's an open seat available at the bar, you better take it. First seat you see, you better sit your a$$ down because we walked around the restaurant hoping to see an open table somewhere and by the time we wanted to go back to the bar area, those seats were taken. All within 30 seconds.

The food was good. Typical bar food. We ordered a buffalo chicken wrap, patty melt and we shared this BIG OL BASKET of garlic fries. Such a huge portions of fries....I'm kinda fried-out for the month. (And for those who know me, I LOVEEEEE MY FRENCH FRIES.) But ugh...no more. =/

Overall, pretty decent place to watch your Sunday football games.
Boyfriend can grab a seat at the bar, get a drink while the girlfriend goes shopping for a bit and then join the boyfriend later. =) Perfect Sunday, right folks?
A great place for good grille food.  Sit on the patio to peoplewatch.  The service is good.  We had a group of 10 and the staff was very accommodating.

Been here twice for two different occasions. Very laidback. Convenient location inside of PH. Quick drinks, nothing fancy. Fun place to go with a group of people to play beer pong and flip cup. The entire back of the bar is set up just for that. But be careful, it can get pretty rowdy during peak times and beer pong gets pretty competitive.

I ended up eating here due to not having enough time to eat anywhere else.  This place is in the Miracle Mile near Planet Hollywood.  It is literally across the walkway from the The V theater.

The 25 ounce beer was great!  The Chicken Strips were almost inedible due to the batter on the chicken being too hard/crunchy.

I would say pass on this place.

Pretty cool place! They have countless tvs with all kinds of sporting events on them, and they have a system where you can listen to your game over your smart phone. This way there isn't fighting over who's game should be heard. Downfalls... the people don't know what channel the games are on. Tried watching an LA Kings game there and was told repeatedly that it wasn't available. Luckily my brother know the owner and regulated... Well wouldn't ya know? They were able to find the game... what a shocker... the all you can drink happy hour is pretty cool too. Get it with the Groupon and save yourself $10. The bad part is that it's all Bud products or well drinks made with ass-flavored liquor. What do you expect for $10? 
Food is meh. 
Vibe is cool.
Chicks in cheerleader outfits... effing awesome!

LETS GO KINGS!!!!

I went here for lunch on Saturday. The boyfriend and I ordered a burger, cheesesteak sandwich, curly fries and a pitcher of beer. My cheesesteak was very very good. I devoured the whole thing within minutes. Had a bite of the boyfriends burger and that was not very good, he regreted not ordering the cheesesteak. Fries were good, nothing special. The beer, well I have no complaints about that. The place is a little pricey for what it is but hey it's Vegas, everything is pricey.

Arrived at this establishment looking for a place to get some wings and watch a Blackhawks game. I got both of those items but it was a pretty painful road to get there. Had to wait about 3 minutes for the hostess to come out front and get us to a table. The floors here are bare concrete and the chairs have metal legs so anytime you move one it sounds like very loud nails on a chalkboard, starting off on the right foot. Get inside and the place is basically empty and the hockey game is on a big screen right in front of us which is nice. The waitress comes around maybe five minutes after we sit down. We order water and guess what they only serve bottled water! Can't imagine how much bottle waste they must have to deal with on a day to day basis but I'm sure they love that extra $1+ they get to charge everyone. And its not like were talking Perrier here you are just getting a generic plastic bottle with their "brand" on it. We ordered some wings they didn't come out  for a decent amount of time. When they did come out they were pretty far past  "Meh" on the universal-wing-scale.  Wait staff didn't come by the rest of the meal to offer us more bottles of water. Had to flag them down to get the bill and get out of there. Basically, if this place is this slow and painful on a slow Sunday I can't imagine what it is like when it is busy. Also, any place that charges you to buy bottled water rather than serve you tap better be amazing and serving you water synthesized from hydrogen gas and oxygen in their custom reaction chamber.

Amber...best customer service ever.  I never wrote a review before until now.  She knew what she was talking about.  Kept honest and had nothing but positive things to say about this place and was genuine.  I've been to vegas multiple times, this is the first time I've eaten here and it was well worth it

If I could give zero stars I would. Hands down bar none the worst service I have EVER had. Went there in a Sunday (11-10-2013)night....while it appeared there were plenty of servers there, you sure wouldn't know it by the lack of assistance we received. We were seated by a hostess immediately, yet out waitress didn't show up for 20 minutes despite our attempt the flag one down. Food orders were COMPLETELY messed up and NEVER were gotten right.  Drinks were not refilled (we were there for an hour half) When we attempted to discuss these issues with the hostess and waitress they simply wanted to spar with us. HORRIBLE place to go. Steer clear of this place.

We walked in for the $3 breakfast special. We got seated and then I think they forgot about us. They finally came and took our order. When we got the food, it was cold. We then had to wait another 5 minutes just to get forks which were never given to us. We had to ask the hostess to bring them to us because the server never brought them out. 

When we finished, the server came to our table and asked if we needed anything else. When we said that we were fine and that we needed the check, she got an attitude problem and just walked away. We got the check 5 minutes later we paid and left. 

I work in the service industry myself so I know that we make more from tips than from our regular wage. I usually go out of my way to do things for guests because I know that I am there for them and they want to have a good experience. This was the first time that I leave a restaurant without leaving a tip. I usually over tip but with the service that poor and with the attitude that she had, she didn't deserve it.

First time here and had Mallory wait on us. She was AMAZING!! Five stars to her... Very refreshing to get an honest upfront server. More  establishments should have servers like Mallory. Hats off to her!!!!!

So I came here the first time I ever came to Vegas and I must admit I rather enjoyed it ALOT ! My husband became a fan he loved the Buffalo wings and so did I, beer was pretty cheap too, the food was pretty good but the service was terrible it takes like 10 to 15 mins just for them to get your drink order and food order and maybe just maybe if your lucky you'll get your order in 30 mins or less. So food was great service not so great that's my review ENJOY !

Blondies has an odd picturesque view is inside of the Miracle Mile Mall. 
There's a fountain is in the courtyard area next to Blondies seating. It does all sorts of cool  lighted water effects, color changing fog, bursts of light as the water dances along with the music.  It is pretty fun to watch and attracts all sorts of weirdos (great people watching!) 

Typically I find shots of Patron to be very expensive. I was tickled to find $5 shots to be a permanent fixture on their menu. I had several of those smooth evening starters. 

Beer is Las Vegas is an absolute joke. No matter where you go it seems you find the generic Bud Lite, Heineken, Corona, etc etc etc crap. It is rare you find  quality craft beer. At Blondies I was able to get Dog Fish Head 60 Minute IPA in 32 ounce mugs for $11..... 

I returned two days in a row. The Patron and Beer lured me back.

The Food here is  2.5 stars and the Alcohol / atmosphere is 4 stars .... Overall this place gets a 3.5 and I would return without hesitation.

Service sucks. Wings are just ok. I don't recommend this place. We waited too long for drinks and when we got our order of wings they didn't give us the extra dip we ordered. When she brought the dip it was friggin tartar sauce and not ranch or blue cheese!! We left.

here for a bachelor party for the weekend, reserved 2 tables....they gave away 1 of our tables and then expected us to pay the 400 dollar reservation fee for the other table when they sat someone else at our table .... totally disrespectful to all of us in the party. Cannot believe the way the server and manager treated us after spending this much money in their establishment. DO NOT GO HERE!

Yeah, yeah.  The food ain't so hot.  But the beer is good and there are plenty of TVs.  The service is pretty and pretty good.  What are you doing a half-mile deep in a mall in Vegas looking for haute cuisine? They have beer, sports and A/C. Park your a** on a stool and wait out the rest of your party as they ooh and aah over baubles and get lost in the mall 'cuz it is shaped like a figure 8.  Cute trick to get more time to drink -- when the wife returns ask her if she saw (insert name of store)  and convince her that she missed part of the mall.

Just for fun, find a picture of their logo and check if you see the same "optical illusion" that my friends and I did.

So here visiting Vegas for the 2nd time with a group of friends. We attended a show at the theatre the previous day and happened to catch this place out of the corner of our eye and had to try it. We all had great food, I personally ordered the sweet habanero wings which were the perfect mix of sweet and spicy. We all had ordered some other things including wings and the garlic fries, as well as chili cheese fries which were all great. However, the problem lies on the service. Our servers name was Jessica. She arrived at the table shortly after we were sat and we waited roughly 10 minutes just for our waters while she was busy talking and charging her phone. After our food order was put in (which was before our drinks had even arrived) we did not see her again for another 15-20mins. I had to get my water refilled at the bar because she was no where to be found, which was odd because there were only a few other tables sat and multiple servers around. Once she finally came back we asked for our checks, which she printed then stood talking to a non ordering table for an extended period of time when we were waiting to leave. Overall, the food was delicious, but the service is exactly what will never bring us back.

I had a Groupon for Blondies that was going to expire the next day.  That figures the way I let Groupons go.  We came here Saturday to use it before we lost its value.

We were seated at a low table in the patio area.  We were brought menus immediately and our drink order was taken.  In a short time, our server--I believe Markiya was her name--came to take our order.

My wife ordered a Philly cheesesteak and I ordered the Reuben.  We were told that a basket of fries was better than two separate orders.  We got the garlic fries.

Both sandwiches were very large and very good.  The garlic fries were very good!   

Service was good.  My iced tea was refilled a couple of times and I didn't need to   ask.  I normally would give a four star rating but the noise level was awful.  It was the first day of the college football season and there were some loud viewers in the main restaurant.  Also, being located where it is along the Miravle Mile Shops walkway makes for more noise.  A plus though is the oppoprtunity to watch tourists.  That's always a lot of fun.  Prices here are also high.  I can get as good in my neighborhood for less money and less driving.

Still, it was a good meal and I'm glad I tried Blondies after walking by all these years.

Blondie's = underrated! Just a typical sports bar with lots of TVs and greasy bar food, BUT there are beer pong tables in the back. The bar supplies cups, balls, pitchers, etc which were relatively cheap. Since O'Shea's is gone (RIP), this will probably become our day time hang out when pool party season is over.

Servers were not at all personable.  Food was OK.  Overpriced!  The server, Maddison, claimed she told us about the added costs NOT on the menu.  After leaving 15% for her average service, she actually followed us out of the place for an additional tip amount!  NEVER had this happen before, EVER!  STRONGLY recommend avoiding this place unless you enjoy paying hidden costs.

This is a great college bar. If you're looking to play beer pong, flip cup, etc with friends and get tanked, this is the place you want to be. We have been here before for lunch and the food and service were lacking, so I would only go here to drink
Really cool place. Good looking waitresses, beer pong tournaments too

$10 for a simple sandwich? That's what you get in Las Vegas. I had Philly cheese steak and Reuben sandwich. Both are just OK.
It's in front of V-theater of Miracle Mile shop connected to planet Hollywood. 
BTW, why is it called blondies? There is no single blond waitress in it. All hooters girls have big breasts, and people know what type of waitress they will get if they go to hooters. But if you go to blondies bar, you will get a black hair waitress.

Over priced drinks (unless you enjoy the cheap stuff). Under par food that my kids couldn't even eat.  This all resulted in an expensive dinner that couldn't even be eaten.  I guess this place would be fine if you wanted to watch a game with just drinking beer, but plan on spending more than necessary.

I was on mission to find a place on the Strip that makes a decent cheesesteak.  So after doing some research I came across Blondies menu, and I was glad to see that they serve cheesesteaks with Amoroso rolls from Philly.  That was all I needed to know.  I came here late at night long after the Miracle Mile shops were closed, so I felt kinda awkward walking thru an empty mall trying to get to this place.  When I got there the place was pretty dead and the waitresses seemed very tired.  The only real noise was coming from the drunk folks playing beer pong, that was pretty entertaining to watch.  Anyways, I ordered a mushroom cheesesteak whiz witout (http://bit.ly/1LCXyXz), and after I took my first bite, I was in cheesesteak bliss.  Sure it might have been because it was 1:30am and I was having hunger pangs, but I didn't care, I was enjoying it.  So why only 2 stars??  Good cheesesteak, but that's pretty much where it ends.  Place was dead, atmosphere was cold, waitresss weren't very motivated.  I'd only suggest stopping by here if you're really hungry and need a quick lunch or late night snack.
Good drinks one day. Great drinks another. Watered down drinks the 3rd day. That's why it got 3 stars. Wish I could have given it more. If go back though.

I went to Blondies for the first time for a Packers game. I looked up the ratings and noticed that it didn't have the best, but was only looking for a cold beer and a game that wasn't available on my TV.

I was blown away by the service and food, not to mention the TVs with every game showing. 

I had a sweet blonde girl, Maria that recommended the ceasar salad. Cold beer, wings and the salad was awesome and so was the service..Maybe in the past, the service was poor but, I'm happy to say that I didn't experience anything like that. I will definitely be going there again for my football and their professional service, sports atmosphere and all the smiles in on the girls.. 

Thanks ladies!

Sincerely,

Stacey  (New Customer and won't be the last)

So my friend and I went here to grab lunch. I had never heard of this place before. I ordered a sub and it came with seasoned fries, and a drink.

The food was filling and service was great. It is a bit of a loud place, but isn't any sports bar?!

We played beer pong after lunch, as they have long tables set up for it in the back.

It cost $21 for the first game of beer pong, and $14 every game after. They give you a pitcher of your choice beer, plastic cups, and ping ping balls.

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun, up beat sports bar, with the ability to play beer pong.

First time ever visiting.  The beers were nice and cold and the food was tasty and hot. Coming from someone who is indecisive and will stare at a menu for hours, our server Jesse recommended the chicken cheesesteak which I ordered and demolished.  I had no complaints!  Left with a full tummy.  Next time I visit the Vegas area I'll be coming back for round two.

$2.99 breakfast was not bad, but just for weekdays. Be aware that orange juice is $5 for a small plastic cup whereas mimosa is only $3. I couldn't find any beverage prices on the breakfast menu. It's clearer on the $4.29 breakfast next door where Bloody Mary or coffee is only $.99.
Great staff and extra large HD TVs to watch all the games with friends!!

Went here for college football on Saturday morning. Friendly staff and was seated promptly. Food is very mediocre. Did not expect Ruth Chris quality, but for the prices, it is on par with a  Furr's or a Denny's. Much better options are all around so do not come here hungry. People were there mainly to drink anyway, so I doubt they care too much about food quality.
APPARENTLY violated terms by using video and certain phrases and by giving 5 stars. Here is the rewrite.

The wife and I totally enjoyed the beer buckets even though they were advertised for $25.00 & we were charged $30.00 plus tax. My concern is nearly twenty-seven dollars for Nachos. They were tasty but we probably should have been advised about the cost. The review we read was from $3.00 didn't expect twenty-three more! Did enjoy the game though.
Great place! Love the atmosphere, great vibes.....bartender Brandon is amazing! Definitely going back for sure!

Quit deleting my damn review.

FYI this is not based on an "Employment Issue." I was obviously NEVER employed here. I'm not blonde and I'm a fatass.

However, besides the fact that the service sucks and the portions & prices blow, I still think employees deserve respect.

I watched a male manager here berate one of the waitresses and tell her she wouldn't have a job anymore if she didn't wear more makeup, as she was in one of their skimpy little blue cheerleader outfits.

And yes, I can base my opinion/review on the ENVIRONMENT as I see fit.

You shouldn't air your bullshit in front of customers. We will never be back.
Stick that in your juice box and suck it.

I ordered a Rachel, which was very generous with the turkey! Super good, especially if you like sauce. I also got sweet potato fries... They powdered the top with powder sugar and serve it with honey.

Terrible service. don't expect them to even try if you have a special food request; I have a dairy allergy and the waitress told me it was hard to communicate with the kitchen and that I pretty much couldn't have anything.  I asked if the wings and chicken were prepared in butter and she told me "they weren't sure". Went to PF Changs where they knew how the food was cooked.

We went in for breakfast and it was worst experience at a restaurant that I've had in at least 5 years.

Service- Slow and nobody was in there and they had enough waitress on staff. Our waitress had an annoying high pitched voice. I would suggest she gets out of the restaurant industry and join the circus.

Coffee- Terrible. When it was suggested that the coffee wasnt good the waitress said the coffee is terrible here but she was glad to get a fresh pot of crap coffee going for us....yum. She should have just served up scolding coffee and dump it on my crotch and have the bar tender throw the cream in my face.

Meanwhile it is taking forever just to get water to us.

Food- the food finally comes out except for my friends who had to sit and watch us eat half our meals before he got his. BTW he got the same thing as everyone else. nothing special.

My meal was Chicken fried steak and eggs. Kinda hard to screw that up. First off they successfully failed. The piece of meat was thin and small to begin with (thats fine) but they over fried the steak. And they served it already cut down the middle (as if they were checking if it was done). The gravy came on the side and looked soupy. Almost Man sauce like. 

I almost felt like  the restaurant cook wanted me to get on my knees and dump hot gravy on my face.

Meanwhile we are in a sports bar right? Well my friend was looking at one direction of the bar that was just showing rap videos (he said he wished he was Tupac'd) and I was facing the projection tv that was completely angled wrong. I felt like I was Biggie Small'd.

This is a place you would want to avoid at all costs!! The service is very lacking, the bathroom is not a place you want to use. The food is mediocre. I should have gone next door to Lombardi's! 
     I blamed this place on the management. They should retrained the staff and clean the bathroom and have better food!! There were 4 of us dining here, we couldn't wait to get the hell out of this restaurant!

Stop by for dinner they had an all you can eat pasta special. We ordered the spaghetti with marinara sauce and the fettuccini Alfredo. We were surprised at how large a bowl of pasta they made for $9.99 per person. The spaghetti was prepared perfectly and not soggy or overcooked pasta. The marinara sauce was tasty and not watery. The sauce stayed on the spaghetti and made the pasta have taste. The fettuccini Alfredo was very good and full of flavor. The Alfredo sauce was not excessively greasy because of the over use of butter or oil. We even had enough to have left overs to take back to the condo. 
The place is a clean sports bar type of environment and decore.  Lot of different screens with all types of sports programs on. They had a full bar. They even had some tables that you can pour your own beer at you own table. If you like beer boy you can have a great time here.

Great food - cheap beer - amazing waitresses - and huge tv's!  This is a great place to watch the game, with lots of cheap beer, and great food. We got the groupon that included a pitcher of beer with burgers and an appy for two for $25 - and it was really good. There is a patio so you can people watch in the miracle mile mall area.. and we all know how fun that is!!

What surprises me is with all of the bars and places to eat and drink around Vegas, literally 100's within a mile radius of this joint you think they would try harder.  I was unfortunate enough to stop by with my son that just turned 21 on this day and we sat at the bar.  A young lady (bartender not cheerleader waitress) asked what were we drinking, I ordered a shock top and son ordered a beer as well.  She asked if we were eating and we said no and she got a grouch look on her face and turned away.  She plopped our beers down and that was it.  She later gave us our check but during our drink we decided that we wanted to grab some food.  We asked the lady for a menu and she gave us one.  We waited 20 minutes, while the whole time we see her talking with her friends, drinking starbucks and doing nothing.  She eventually came and said oh what did you want to eat.  I was furious, I said we waited 20 minutes and that was crazy, asked to speak with a manager, she said she was the manager.  I find that hard to believe.  She said, "well you originally said you didn't want to eat"  I said, "well I thought I made it clear 20 minutes ago when I asked for menus and said we decided we wanted to eat"

She then proceeded to tell us that a girl was on break and she was swamped.  See above on my comment on what she was doing the whole time.  I said was it because the way I was dressed.  Sleeveless shirt, basketball shorts and sunglasses, she got defensive and said no.  Well trust me, I had money to spend and lots of it, but I refuse to go anywhere and beg for service.  The kicker was I paid 20 dollars for two beers!

I strongly suggest to avoid this place and try the gazillion other establisments in Las VEgas.

Bachelor Party, Pre party location for 10 guys.  UFC fights, all you can drink beer ($80 per person), bar food.  Its a 3 star all the way around.  Food was good (bar food) service however was slow.  Yes, place was packed due to the fights, but the fights didn't just happen.  They were planned, so should have planned more staff.  Service was my biggest complaint.  GREAT AMOUNT OF TVS.  Perfect sports bar, just needed a little more service from the staff

this is one of those places you eat at cuz you're walking around and suddenly hunger creeps in... and walking anywhere else is really too far.  

the cheerleader-esque waitresses usually hover over their podium outside gossiping... and once in awhile one of them will look up and seat you.  

and if you want to order water... its bottled only (for like $1 i believe... which is cheap for bottled water here... but expensive cuz you just wanted friggen FREE water right?)  

dont order soup (fuck you diet)... it's definitely from a progresso can... you get like half a can of soup for like $5-6.  

tiny and dry chicken wings...

philly cheese steak sandwich is good... except for the bread, which is COLD?!

$10 all you can drink during happy hour... that's pretty sweet though.

Eh....

Went to Blondie's for the National Championship game with a group.  I was not impressed. the place wasn't crowed like you might think. I'm sure that was due to the high cover charge for the game though.

The bar food was just that, bar food. The problem is that it wasn't very good. the wings were sub par - very bland and rather small, cheese sticks were nasty, and the meatballs were a gelatinous mass. Yuck!!!

The service was OK, but nothing special. You would have thought that at an event like that they could keep up, but they couldn't. Our waitress only had a couple of other tables and no one was drinking heavily, and folks were still running out. 

This place definitely had a dive feeling to me, but without the charm a good dive should have.

Another one bites the dust. 

I fell victim to its convenient location to the V Theater.  We were seeing a show and decided to grab a bite to eat.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  That was the end of the good.  

Service was just ok. I don't think we received a refill on either of our drinks.  A different guy brought our food to the table so the waitress didn't do much. 

It's funny how on their menu it's labeled in a special box ' Famous Cobb Salad'.  I love Cobb salads so I wanted to try it.  What was famous about their salad? I couldn't figure it out.  Just about every other Cobb salad I've eaten, the toppings are diced.  Not this one they served.  It looked like a disaster.  The tomatoes were sliced.  The bacon wasn't in diced pieces.  It just wasn't good and wouldn't order again.  

With a premium location, I'd hope something improves here.

Blondies is hands down the most fun and best sportsbar in Vegas!!! I am here for every big fight or sporting event and it is always a wild time.  You pay upfront at the door for all you can drink.  If you want a table, call ahead and get one booked.  Make sure to do so way in advance because the place fills up fast! The service is great, environment is always fun, food is delicious, and they make some of the best drinks in Vegas.

Ok the only reason they get one star is because I had to give them one to write a review!  This is the worst place for drinks I have ever been to! Do not get all you can drink deal unless you like cheap beer! They say well drinks are included but they taste like absolute crap! Well water that had fermented would be better then the drink. I actually tried to return it and was told I would have to pay 10 for it, when it was u drinkable! The place had only about 10 people in it but the waitstaff is so slow you would think the ace was packed! Horrible derive and drinks. You are better off going and playing the slots and getting free drinks!

Gotta agree with the others on here in that the service sucks! Although they did provide water with our food. Good thing cause I needed it to choke down the gross turkey, bacon and avocado wrap I ordered. The free appetizers they had out were even worse and they didn't even bother to put plates out so people were just eating with their hands. This seems to be a bar that thinks it's cool but it's not.

Eww! This place feels gross to me. The staff is friendly but the table was sticky and the drink (yes drink not drinks because I wasn't wasting calories on a crappy cocktail) was weak. Blah all cocktail juice, no alcohol. I won't be returning.

No. Just no. 

We were informed to come here after TAP at MGM said they were one of the few places showing the McGregor/Diaz and Holm/Tate fight.

Got there and there was a bit of a line that moved quickly. The bouncer told us it would be $60 a person cover but "all you can drink" once you're inside. Two of my friends immediately left because they didn't want to pay that much for cover. My other friend and I wanted to check other places first (Twin peaks & Cabo Wabo). Other places were at least $75 with nothing included so Blondies seemed like a better deal. 

We came back, paid the $60 and were shocked when we got inside. (you can't see the inside of the bar on fight night as there as black curtains draped everywhere). It was PACKED. When I say packed I mean they should have a maximum capacity limit which they clearly ignored. Every table was taken, and they had chairs set up in every other open floor area which were also all taken. People were literally eating pizza off of the floor due to lack of seating and tables. 

They also didn't tell us that "all you can drink" meant ONLY bud light. My friend doesn't even drink beer (gluten intolerance) so it was a total rip off for her. Bud light is not my drink of choice, I would have rather had a cheap well vodka with soda. This was so deceiving and should have been told to us at the door upon taking our money. 

It was just pure chaos. We paid $60 to stand and be pushed by rushed waitresses telling us "excuse me" and "please move" for FOUR HOURS!!! 

I would NEVER come back here. Staff is dishonest and only wants your money. I've never been more uncomfortable in a bar in my life. Never again. STAY AWAY!

In Vegas on a layover and decided to stop in. My server was Alyssa. A cute little brunette. She did such a great job selling me on the nachos which were phenomenal and the melon martini which was just perfect! Alyssa gave us amazing service. Will deff tell all my flight attendant friends to come visit when in town and request Alyssa!

What's better than a red beer and people watching?
I think locals appreciate this more, because I was entertained four a couple hours watching everyone roaming by.

Good bar food and a few great bartenders.

We have been once in the evening for drinks. Lots of college kids playing Beer Pong...not an issue; they were having a great time. When yesterday for lunch. The service was good; server was very attentive but not bothersome. I had the Cobb Salad, it was HUGE and really good. I would recommend it but definitely for sharing. My husband had the Philly Cheesesteak; this was also large. He said it was good but he wasn't blown away. None of the sandwiches some with fries, they are $4 extra. The menu was very basic; nothing to make them stand out. But I would return for lunch as it was a quick in and out with pretty good food.

I came here last year 2011 around April during a softball tourney with some co-workers. I was sold on this place because it was EMPTY. It allowed a gang of us to play beer pong in peace, and get drinks and food without an issue.

I will admit getting the waitresses attention was sometimes difficult, even with there being less than 15 people in the entire place. This may have been due to the fact I was not sober.

We did order the big tall beer thingy. From what I recall it was a decent deal split among friends. But who's looking at deals when you're with a gang of cool buds, eating bar food, and playing some beer pong?!

I'd recommend dropping in with a group if its not too crowded, as there is plenty of seating/TV's. I can only imagine it gets packed here during March Madness or regular football season.

Side note: waitresses are indeed dressed to only what Vegas can offer.

Overall I was pleased with the place and will drop by to see if it was the same as it was a year ago. March madness, here we go!

I was skeptical when I saw their sign that advertised breakfast for $2.99 on weekdays, but I gave it a try. The breakfast came with 2 eggs, sausage, bacon, and hash browns! The wait was 1/3 of Dennys on the strip and this was a much nicer atmosphere! Definitely try it if you're in town on a weekday!

Just got back from spending the weekend in Vegas. We wanted to watch the Mayweather fight somewhere, and so I did a little research before we hit the road. Called Blondies and was told that they would have the fight, and that the cover charge would be $40 a person, which would include all the beer you can drink. SCORE!! So on the way over to Blondies, I call to make sure there's still space available, and am told there is, but the cover is now $60.....hmmmm. Okay. Still not terrible since it includes drinks. Well, then we get to the front to pay our entrance, and are now told it's $80!!!!!!!!!!!! I explained that I had just called minutes ago, and was given the $60 price. They didn't give a crap. Bottom line (it's Vegas after all) is to make money. The guys working the front were fairly rude, which makes it even worse when handing your money over to them. 
Well we decided that since we were already there, we'd suck it up....and pay. I didn't want to use all my cash so I proceeded to pay with my debit card. Oh darn, they only take cash!!! So one of the rude guys tells the little waitress to show me where the ATM is located in the restaurant. She takes me right to it, and then I turn around and she's gone???!!! So I get my money, go back to the rude goons at the front and stand there FOREVER while they just ignore me. Then it hit me, Hey, I'm in this joint. You want to be rude jerks?? Okay, cool. Me, and my money (safely back in my pocket) are winning this round. I found my boyfriend inside and drank PLENTY OF FREE BEER, and watched the fight. For nada, zip, zilch!! Ha Blondies, suck it. I win. 

The money I didn't spend here, I spent the next day at the Pub at Monte Carlo. Way better place to watch sports, and have all inclusive food/drinks. No surprises on the price. When I called I was told $40 all you can drink....when we got there,$40 all you can drink!! This is on Sunday's btw. So you can post up and watch football and have a GREAT time. So save yourself the bs that is Blondies. Go elsewhere. Where they're honest about prices, and don't act like idiots when you get there.

We were looking for a good place to do happy hour where the boys could watch some sports. Lured by the $20 all you could drink 3pm-6pm, Blondie's seemed like the best choice closest to our evening shows. Well, started off rocky when it took nearly a half an hour for a waitress to come to our table. When she got there, we promptly told her we were looking for the $20 deal. Well, you go to the bar for that and when you need a refill you go back to the bar, she took care of food orders. Ok so we ordered some food and went and got our first rounds of drinks. Bartender was a little sarcastic but hey so am I. Second round of drinks? Not so quick and more attitude from the bartender. 3rd round? We had to wait in line at the bar and bartender was, dare I say it, a little ruder still. By the time we felt as though we had gotten our money's worth, we had worked pretty hard for our beers. In addition, our waitress came to our table and asked if she could give us our bill as her shift was over. We were all done eating so no problem. Well we sat there another hour and a half and our waitress was still helping other tables, giving us the impression she didnt have to leave but just didnt want to tend to our table any more. All in all, pretty lackluster experience at Blondies. 

As for the sports on the tvs for the boys? Well there was for the first hour until the infomercials came on and no one bothered to change the channels.
I ordered a patty melt and side salad.  The meal was pretty good for a sports bar. Definitely would visit again.
64$ for wings/salsa/sliders/2 beers.. And on the chips n salsa, they put the salsa on the chips in the basket. It was weird..the staff was nice however.
The bartender we had tonight was very rude right from the beginning.  All he cared about was groping the waitresses.

Cool place, within the Miracle Mile Shops, to grab a drink (or food). Lots of decorations to help the wondering eye, many tv screens-showing all types of sporting events/news, and a killer bar. 
We had some cold ones, as we pondered what to do the rest of the day, in Vegas. A staff member came around to snap a "voluntary" postcard photo of you. The postcard is cute, but if you love who you're with and the photo is adorbs, you'll likely shell out $20, like we did, for the larger, Vegas-themed backdrop with it. It resembles what you'd find at an amusement park. The staff was nice, but a tad slow behind the bar. Aka busy.

Such a great sports bar in the Miracle Mile shops. My waitress Fernanda was really funny and sweet and kept the drinks coming :-)
I will be back soon!

THERE ARE BETTER SPORTS BARS!
AVOID 
I went to see the Canelo vs Cotto fight
they charged people a ridiculous amount of money. 
The owner or manager was rude to people and just took money out of their hand as they were paying without being inviting or thanking people or making eye contact with guests!!!!
During the fight the sound was lacking and would completely go away. 
The first time we were like okay whatever they will fix it.
Wrong! ... it kept going away and just ruined the fight. 
The manager should of at least showed up and could of explained what was going on but he would go away and his workers had to pretend like they were trying to "fix" the sound
Also one of the servers could not simply walk to the trashcan to throw away a cup full of ice, she rudely threw it instead and it landed on a women next to me!!!. 
They need to work on their customer service and try to be more friendly!.

Not good I do not recommend.  My family went here for breakfast because my dad thought it "looked good".  It wasn't.  I even got pancakes because I thought how could they mess those up?  The pancakes tasted gross like the dirty grill.  No one liked their food except my dad who wanted a "big ole burger".

Saw a breakfast plate deal advertised on 4 tv screens in front of restaurant for $2.99.  We, family of 4, got seated 11:05am & attempted to order the advertised $2.99 shown on screens.  Waitress tells us that breakfast is over at 11am.  We called her attention to the large 4 tv screens & that it did not mention any expiration times.  She tells us we had to order from the lunch menu.  We told her this was deceptive advertising.  We also asked why they still advertised the $2.99 breakfast deal after 11am (their breakfast cut off).  She told us it is posted until noon each day even when no one can order that special after 11am.  Then she wanted to know what we would like to order from their lunch menu, where the prices were much high.  Deceptive advertising to get customers in!  Bait & switch method used on customers!  Would not recommend!
Do not expect good service. We finally left cause no waitress came to our table and none of the other waitresses cared when we asked.

Horrible service. We called ahead to see if they were going to be playing a game we wanted to see, and they confirmed yes. Then we got there, and wouldn't agree to put it on. Not nice people. Then we waited at the table, and we got our water,and she never returned. We left. Not worth it!!!

This has been the best service I've had, since I arrived in Vegas. Our server Ariel was on point. She was very attentive and went the extra mile for our table. You can't beat their prices for breakfast. I personally ordered two breakfast plates and still paid under $10.

Blondie's in Planet Hollywood is a very upbeat fun place!! I bartend there from 1-8 am on Fridays and Saturdays and even between those hours there is never a dull moment! With all you can drink specials from 3-6pm and beer pong you will never be bored at this place no matter what time it is! Come check it out for yourself!!!

Places that will not give me a glass of water when I am eating there are so lame.  If I am a paying customer you shouldn't require me to order a bottle of water as well.  Food was okay.. I frequent Vegas about 5-7 times a year, and sometimes stay at the PH.  But won't ever be eating here again on principle.  Provide your paying customers with water people, really.
Service was great! 5 stars go to Hannah, she was so sweet and helpful. Our group was being kind of annoying and she didn't mind at all.
I was staying at the Elara hotel and it was conveniently connected to the miracle mile. Blondes offered a $2.99 breakfast special. I was impressed with the efficiency of the service.  Not bad.

The food would have tasted better if the service was better. Our server was uber busy and never even helped us out. She took care of everyone else around us though. Lame. The only thing that was cool was the girl who took our order and got our drinks. Wait a sec, was SHE our server? 

Who knows.

It was the middle of the afternoon and the basketball game was about to begin. There was going to be a cover charge to enter Blondies after 3p. Luckily we got there earlier because I would have been very disappointed if we had to pay a cover. Sure, us girls were not in the mood to watch sports but still. 

Next time I'll pass. I bet the stripper bar across the hall had better service. ;)

Great sports bar. They have a all you can drink for $20... Well drinks and domestic beer until 6:00 pm. Lani was our waitress and she was AWESOME! Great customer service! We had steak and eggs for breakfast and it was tasty.. $5 Bloody Marys until 11:00am. .. Great place to come and kick back and have some drinks. The overall customer service here was GREAT and I would highly recommend this sports bar!

Overpriced mediocre food. DO NOT go here. The service was awful! We had to ask our waitress three times for napkins and silverware! Super slow service and to top it off the waitress charged us for an item we didn't even order. Never coming to this place again!!

Big game on the hundreds of TVs they had there. Great for the sports fanatics or those of us that like to watch the sports fanatics. Wait staff are friendly, knowledgeable but too few for the crowd that was there Friday night. Food was good, drinks were good too. Would recommend this place if you were staying at the Elara Hilton of close by. A good place to relax for a little while until moving on to the next thing on your list.

I went to Blondies one night with some friends. There was a beer pong tournament going on. All of the people playing were overly competitive including members of the staff/owners of the bar who were drinking. One of the owners was instigating fights between patrons of the bar. I also heard one of the managers use several racist terms while breaking up a fight that broke out over a game of beer pong. Out of all the bars I've been to in Las Vegas, Blondies is HANDS DOWN THE WORST!!

Not a bad place to grab a quick drink and some food.

We were brought in by the host and hostess as they told us the deal was $10 Draughts!  We bit, and came in because we also wanted food.  There were a lot of beer pong matches going on as it was a Thursday night and that seems to be the theme.  We ordered some food, and I ordered the "Build your own Burger" and it was pretty damn good.  You get your choice of THREE toppings as well as cheese - I opted for Avocado, Blue Cheese and Bacon -  and skipped the extra cheese.

It was interesting though when our bill came because they waitress told us the beer we were drinking was "not included"... even though we told her we had the bands, and wanted to "try" the best beer AND the host and hostess specifically told us come in for $10 DRAUGHT beers, and the menu said $10 DRAUGHT beers - so maybe there was small print with that but if we have bands, and we are drinking anything BUT what is included, you would think they would question it.

Anyways - They were nice enough to drop those off our bill becuase it was clearly a misunderstanding by all parties.  Because of that, they get an extra star!  The downfall of this place is the noise-  It's filled with screaming college kids playing beer pong on Thursdays, Im sure other days may be a bit more relaxed as it wouldnt have the wristbands, so when I am in town again, I will be stopping in again.

Horrible establishment! My brother and I flew to Vegas for the Mayweather / Pacquiao fight and this joke of a place one supposed to be one of few places approved to show the fight. We prepaid $300 each and when we arrived, the hostess stated, "just a heads up, we're having negotiation problems with the MGM and may not be able to get the fight."

Our waitress finally broke the news that they hadn't met their number and the fight was a no - go.  They refunded our money, but there was no place for us to go to watch it.  Blondies management knew they didn't have the fight, but was willing to gamble with its patrons.

Do not spend your time and money at this joint...totally jacked up my fight weekend.  This place is a joke!

We used a Groupon, and felt like it was a great deal.

Great Rockin Nachos, Melted cheese, PLUS nacho cheese. filled with beans/jalepenos/and all the toppings. Not sure if I would pay 12$ for them regularly but with the Groupon it was a good deal! 

I had a build your own burger with bleu cheese and bacon. YUM. HUGE. altho no fries, you have to pay 3$ to add fries to a meal. It was okay for use though because we had a LOT of food. My husband ordered the philly cheese steak sandwich, and he thought it was decent. He thought he probably would try something else next time.

Service was great, altho we were there at a low low time, as they weren't very busy. Lotsa TV's lotsa cute girls....

I'm unsure about my overall feeling. It might be SUPER fun on a big sports night!

We were not impressed after coming to Blondies. We were so hungry, and wanted something that would cost under $20 a person, so we came to blondies. 
When we arrived we were promptly seated, and given menus. We weren't ready the first time the waitress came around, so she left, and we waited for a good 15 minutes for her to come back. Finally she came and we ordered. My mom and were feeling the same thing, grilled cheese and tomato soup. So we ordered, and we waited. We waited at least another 25 minutes, but mind you, when you are super hungry it feels longer. 
During the wait, I needed to use the restroom. Somehow I didn't see the restroom sign, so I went and asked the hostess. She was startled when I approached her because she was in her phone. After seeming annoyed, she showed me where it was. 
The first thing I noticed about the bathroom was that it was very dirty. I actually waited for a different stall, because the only other one available had urine on the toilet. When I went into the other stall, it was of mediocre cleanliness. It wasn't as awful as the last one, but it still smelled awful and there was toilet paper everywhere. I felt dirty after leaving that restroom. 
After leaving the restroom, I go back to our table where our food has finally come. The grilled cheese was luke warm, and I'm not even exaggerating! There was a single slice of cheese, and it was only half melted. My mom brought this to the waitress' attention, and even she agreed this was unacceptable (Especially after waiting SO long..) She took it back, and brought us menus to order something else. 
Again, after this she was gone for another 15+ minutes!!!!! When she finally came to take our order, we just ordered two apps to share. We ordered tacos and chicken strips, and at $12 or $13 for chicken strips, they didn't even come with fries!! OH well, its vegas right? So we ordered and continued to wait. Again, after ordering the second time it was at the VERY least another 25 more minutes until we got our food. I asked for some extra ranch, and that alone took 10 more minutes. Mind you, I didn't mention that they were so slow when we were there so I am not sure what was going on. 
The ONLY good thing about this experience was the food. The chicken strips were hot, and so tasty and the tacos had just the right amount of spice to them. My mom said the tacos were luke warm, but I thought they were fine. I mean the meat inside was hot, can't expect the lettuce and other fixings to be hot. 
I wish I would have remembered our waitress' name, because even though the service was slow, she was super nice and very apologetic toward us, and even took $7 off of our bill so that was a plus. 
After all was said and done, we were there for the better part of two hours. It was kind of ridiculous, but we left full finally. I'm just glad we didn't have plans or anything after cause we surely would have missed them

Also, for what its worth, not that I care, but none of the waitresses on staff were blonde when I was there, not one!

I've been here before but this time I felt the need to write a review seeing as there are so many negative reviews. My experience was great.
