Aside from the food being fast and delicious, the price was reasonable for a meal and drink on the strip. The best part however was the service. We were welcomed warmly by the host Joanna and as soon as we were sat, we were quickly greeted by our server Savannah. The service was excellent and was made even better by her warm cheerful attitude. Although it seemed a bit busy and she was running around a lot, she answered any questions we had and gave her suggestions and gave thorough service. Great place to grab a bite and a drink and watch the games. Highly recommended

Not sure why this place has low ratings, maybe it's because they have a cover charge for sport games? Anyways, we walked into this place this weekend while looking for a place to eat. The servers were friendly and the food was great. I got hot wings with a basket of curly fries. We also got shots on the house...well for 8 cents haha

$100 a head to watch the Mayweather vs. Mosley fight here with an open bar.  Located in The Miracle Mile Shops.

Fight was wack.  Spent about 2.5 hours here from 7PM-9:30PM when the fight ended.  Ended up paying an additional $70 for a couple servings of french fries and hot wings to go along with all the beer and alki.  The server chick we had was pretty attendant to us considering how packed this place was for the fight.  We paid $100 a head and got seats and our own server while a lot of other people paid $60 and I believe they had to go up to the bar to get their open bar drinks.  I really thought we'd all get a lot more drunk since we all threw down $100 each, but I'd say on average out of our group of 11 dudes, we probably only put down about 3 beers and a shot each.  I got a 3 beers, a shot, and 2 jack and cokes.  Could've done more, but the stomach wasn't liking me that night.  Not sure if it was the food or the previous 2 nights of drinking in Vegas.

Place is alright overall, nothing special.  Just another sports bar & grill with a bunch of TVs and server ladies dressed up like cheerleaders.
Owners are a joke. Especially the one with the gambling and drinking problem that tries his best to have sex with the staff....fail.

God!!! This place was amazing. We had the groupon, which was amazing. But even without the groupon it was worth the price. I loved the food, some of the employees were nice. 

Would def go back again, considerin I went twice. LOL

Waitresses/ hostess were very polite. However, Extremely slow service despite the place being empty. Took about 10-15 mins to get water and quite a while to get our meal. My BF ordered the patty melt which he said was very good and I ordered the spinach artichoke dip. I wouldn't recommend - it tasted like frozen creamed spinach.

First time eating here, we ordered the garlic bread balls ($7.99- it was good),spinach artichoke dip ($14.99- NO!!! it taste like the one you buy at the grocery frozen section)and rib eye steak ($26.99- Like it!! was juicy and tender).

Waited 40 mins when there was only 5 people in the restaurant. First my fries came out then 10 mins later my burger then another 5 mins my soup. So basically my fries were cold so I couldn't enjoy them with my burger. Their waitresses are definitely blondes
Now I know why they called this place Blondies!

We were visiting Vegas for the weekend and picked up a couple of groupons before we went so a groupon brought us into Blondies. 

We started with the nachos, they were huge and very good. We probably could have just gone with the nachos for lunch the serving was that big. 

We each had a burger, bacon and avocado on mine and bacon and bleu cheese for my bf. The burgers were very tasty and cooked to perfection. Add a pitcher of shock top and we were quite happy. 

The server was nice, attentive enough but not always bothering us. Would go back next time in town.

Unfortunately, I will never go back to eat here again.  The food is good, but the SERVICE and management is horrible.  I was in a party of 3 (2 adults & a teen) in the middle of the afternoon and had a bill of $75+ dollars.  20% of that was gratuity.  The server never came back to our table once!  Once we received our food, we never got refills of drink nor did we get the condiments that we asked for.  

So in my opinion these servers add the gratuity at their discretion because they know that their service was poor.  Gratuity is not a guarantee, it is not for them to decide.  

Never again!

We had a blast here for breakfast. It's not a fancy place but during the week it's cheap breakfast and $3 mimosas! The food is good and a fun place to sit under the sky like roof. The staff was very friendly! Was the only meal in Vegas that didn't break the bank, we would have went here every morning if it were a week day!

There wasn't anything spectacular about this place at all. They had a sign  up on the wall Maxim Magazine voted them one of the best bars in the country a few years back.  Maybe it was super cool a few years ago, but as for now, I beg to differ.  The hostess asked if we would be eating, and we told her yes.  She then told us to grab a seat anywhere we'd like.  We sit, and another woman rushes over and tells us nobody is serving that section.  Strange, since the place isn't huge. But anyway.. we sit elsewhere and she comes over and asks if we would be eating.  Yes. Then she made some rude, unnecessary comment about the hostess forgetting to give us menus.  We ordered our drinks and decided to go with the appetizer sampler.  It was about $22 and came with a few different appetizers.  Honestly, all were bad.  I understand that most bar food is fried food.. but c'mon.  This stuff was literally drenched.   You could taste the oil which was so unappetizing.  My weird husband must have been starving because he said it was alright.  I deemed everything inedible and let him have the rest.  For a drink, I opted for the amaretto sour.  The sweetest, weakest $8 amaretto sour in the world.  It strangely tasted like cherry kool-aid.  What's up with that!? I never really read Maxim Magazine before, but after this.. I don't think they can be trusted.

I was walking inside the miracle mile shops  and came across this huge sports bar. Walls covered with sports memorabilia and huge TVs and projectors. I decided to sit at the bar where an awesome bartender by the name of Bell greeted me with a welcoming smile and had a very genuine vibe about herself. She sold me on doing the $20 All you can drink domestic drafts and wells happy hour. Let's say I definitely took advantage of bottomless drinks and had myself a great time.
Horrible place. Service was below poor and the food was horrible. Never ever going here

Dear PH: How in the world is this establishment  still open?
I made the mistake of not checking Yelp first and sat down here with friends from Berlin that want to try everything American, after ordering a Rib Eye Steak the disappointment set in. . . Previously frozen , water tasting, fibrous shoe sole, hunk of dead animal, for 28 dollars! Steamed broccoli was mushy and cold, really? How do they screw up steamed broccoli?  The bake potato was decent. 

Service? 

The waitress got our order wrong at first, them blamed it on me because it would come out of her paycheck. Then returned to apologize for her tone but still blamed me ! Haha! 

Well, I will never ever recommend this place to anyone. KCM needs to be removed from this business and the staff needs a wake up call.

Disgusting food, overpriced menu, and lame service. Run, don't walk, away from here. We went around 10:30pm and ordered chips and salsa, small order of boneless wings, and 2 sodas. $37 later - gross wings, stale chips, and chunky brown salsa. Don't even bother, seriously.

Great location to watch sports.  They do take reservations the day before but don't let that keep you away because you'll still probably get a seat.  Good burger and fries and of course bucket of cheap beers

There's Low Standards and No Standards! They WIN NO STANDARDS! 

Don't be deceived this establishments looks fun and exciting, however the services is TERRIBLE! If you enjoy being treated like the dirt at the bottom of your shoe, this is the place for you.  However, if you like to receive great customer service and a delightful meal for a reasonable price this is NOT the place for you.  I went to "BLONDIES" after a late night wedding in Vegas and it was to die for or from in the literal.  
1) It took forever to get service and food (people that were seated after us were eating before us) 2) One of the individuals in my groups order was not correct 3) The one thing I order a baked potato was cold and old 3) The manager could careless and he let us know it from the response he gave my friend.  

When it was all said and done, I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt! So, I took matters into my own hands and said to myself maybe a different approached and a different manager would bring so much need light to the situation.  Nope, I will say at least the other manager attempted to listen, until the rude and disrespectful manger decided to interject with his ignorance (adding fuel to the fire).  As a result, of being completely disrespected and devalued as a customer, I decide to attempt to contact the owner (no success, however not surprised), and finally I decided to write something to caution other travelers not to waste your money at a place like this, when there are other great and fabulous venues in Vegas worth the money.  I refuse to spend my hard earned money at place that could careless how customers are treated.  The staff is a reflection of the management and the management is a reflection of the ownership.  There end is the problem no accountability and employees are allowed to treat customers less than civilized.  They are one of the only establishments open late on Miracle Mile and thus they could careless, plus they aren't about building customer loyalty. 

Good Luck if you dare to Dine there!

When visiting Blondies always ask for a table near a waitress!  We had high hopes for this bar but the service and quality of food was disappointing.  If the staff didn't spend so much time gossipping behind the bar then imagine how much more food and beer they could sell...I do miss their fish and chips though (as often as I can)

My wife and I went in to have some wings and fries. Let me say our waitress Taylor was absolutely amazing. The food was fast, drinks faster and service was top notch. If you have had a few to drink and want some great food come into Blondies and enjoy a good meal.
Their are tv's in every corner, so you won't miss a second of the action. There are 4 beer pong tables that you can enjoy and possibly get over your buzz. 
The best thing is that the food was fast and the service (waitress) was outstanding. 
So cone by here at the end of the night and enjoy some good food. We will be back mainly because of Taylor.

Stopped in Blondie's for lunch the other day while playing tourist on the Strip over the weekend. The place looks pretty cool and there are lots of big TVs everywhere to watch your favorite sporting event. The hosts and waitresses were all dressed in their cute little cheerleaders outfits.

I grabbed a sandwich and fries to eat and it was quite delicious. For being in a tourist section, all in all it wasn't a bad place to try out.  Though as a local, I wouldn't find myself making a special trip there just to eat or drink or to watch a sporting event.

But if in the area, I would go there again.

This place is awful. Chips and salsa: chips were stale. Waitress: slow, totally oblivious to her customers and cared more about gossiping with her fellow waitresses. Music: crappy club music no one in their right mind wants to hear the day after in Vegas. 

I highly suggest going to Lombardi's restaurant next door.

This place had some of the most impersonal service i have ever had.  Standoff-ish waitresses who took forever to recognize i wanted a food menu in addition to a beer.  I worked as a waiter thru school and have never seen such disregard for personal attention.  No conversation, no up sales, & dropped off my change without a receipt after dropping off the bill without a word. The wings and beer, along with the Cowboys/Saints game were great.  I will never come here again. Unless its the only place to see the game in Las Vegas.

Recently went to this place.  And need I just say ill stick with Applebee's next time. Food wasn't great for the price.  Service was HORRIBLE.   Waitress was chatting it up w her fellow friends and not friendly. Deffinately won't be going back!!

Good:
1: Immediate seating.
2: Bathroom inside restaurant
3: Nice waitress.
4: Good food.
5: Vegas Bite Card discount.

Bad:
1: Cold in December!

If I could, I would give this place an in between 2-3. The food wasn't awful but it wasn't great. My husband and I sat out on the "patio" area at a high top table. The service honestly wasn't bad and our experience was brief. I was actually really excited about this place. I liked the idea of a girly sports bar as a girly sports fan and I dug the waitress and hostess cheerleader uniforms as a former cheerleader. It was cute and seems like a great place to catch a game and a beer. It's a little small but they have a ton of TVs (as one would expect in a sports bar!) I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato for $10 and it didn't come with fries. What kind of restaurant serves sandwiches without fries? For $10!!!!! My cheese wasn't melted all the way so the sandwich was doomed from the second I laid eyes on it! My husband got a turkey club. It was nothing special but again, no fries came with it and it was around $13.

While they weren't the worst sandwiches we have ever had, we feel as though the place is a complete rip off. Though, most places in Vegas are the same way. We were just extremely disappointed.
Wings und fries sind sehr lecker. Das frühstück ist horror......hab es 3 mal zurück gehen lassen. Das gute an der bar ist, das sie championsleauge zeigen mit deutscher beteiligung

Had a great experience with a pretty blonde server named Ariel! Came in to eat and order a medium rare steak. It was cooked perfect!! I had a baked potato and broccoli as a side! So good! My server was super attentive and kept my cold beers coming!!! I will definitely keep coming back!! Also, the staff had great team work and everyone was attending to their customers!!!

We hit Blondie's for lunch on Saturday.  It's really a sports bar... they have a ton of TVs and some tables that can be used for beer pong and they have tables with taps in the middle and it's very loud in there.

We were seated at one of the tables with a tap, but chose not have beer on that occasion so missed that opportunity.  Our server was friendly and attentive to us.  We used an Entertainment coupon which allows for one free entree when a second is purchased.  The husband had the club sandwich and I built my own burger with cheese, mushrooms and a friend egg.  We both really enjoyed our food.  I liked that they didn't overcook the egg!

It looks like they have some great specials.  We noticed there is a happy hour special for all you can drink beer for $20 for a three hour period... wow, you could go crazy with that.

You have to understand though, that this place is very loud and while in the Miracle Mile shops, feels kind of ratty.  But, hey, it's a sports bar.

I'd eat there again.

So this bar is the meeting place of The Show from San Diego State University if they are in Las Vegas. 

They have lots of beer pong tables, decent looking waitresses in cheerleader outfits, and ice cold Fireball shots. 

Lots of TVs and big tables to handle our big groups for watching any sporting event.

Used to come here back in the day when we lived in Vegas, so we thought we would check it out while on vacation a few weeks back. To my surprise, Blondies was still kickin! We had a great time and our bartender, Brandon, was on point slangin those drinks. After we ate all of the delicious cheese sticks and drank the vodka dry, we bought a couple t-shirts and left there about 5 in the morning, haha! Good times!!

A seedy bar in the Miracle Mile. Very college bar like. They have beer pong tournaments every Wednesday and Thursday, and the winner(s) get a $500 bar tab. If you want a good game of pong while staring at the giant plastic stripper outside of the stripper bar, then head here. Definitely not the place to go for a classy drink with your date.

fandamntastic ... 

all tired from walking, head ready to explode ... walked into tacky sports bar

waitress said ... wait ... in a minit it's $10 for two hours of drinking

we did ... my gf ... my friend ... my friends gf ... and I

food common, drinks (on special) common ... waitresses hot! (gf kept wacking my arm) ... service great!!!

no question ... on my list to return ... had sports ... had waitresses ... had beer pong (jesuschristie!) ... had way fun (gf fine now ... had good time)

I came in to have a beer and watch the game with some friends. I wasn't really expecting much but I ended up having a fantastic time . My server Ashley honestly made the whole experience . She was so friendly and kept the drinks coming ! We didn't even have to ask her for refills on our waters, which is an A++ in my book! I will defiantly be coming back and sending friends. If you decide to go in and have a drink make sure you ask for Ashley! You won't be disappointed!
The burger was pretty much the only thing that was good here. Beer selection was pretty limited and service was mediocre at best. It's a bummer that the buffalo wild wings isn't open yet.

may I give the fried garlic dough balls one million stars? don't hesitate, don't bother to read the description, just Trust Me and order them. you will thank me later. perhaps not so much those around you later because did I mention the garlic? there's like a whole field of them in there.

lots of TVs, everywhere, perfect for sports-watching. service, albeit a bit distracted, is super sweet. beer is only $6, which is a screaming deal for vegas. the food is your typical over-priced bar fare, and really if you're eating anything other than the fried dough balls, well, don't say I didn't tell you so.

As L and I wandered around the Miracle Mile looking for something good to eat we decided to stop by Blondie's and figure out where we were in relation to the front of the hotel.  We were actually attempting to get to the Hawaiian Tropic restaurant.  The girl in front literally looked at me and was like, "Um, you're in the Miracle Mile... in the Planet Hollywood."  HELLO, DUH!   I said nothing.  So, tired of wandering and having food smells lure us in, we decided to eat at Blondies.

The waitress seemed fine until she started talking.  L was feeling like a beer but the selection sucked- at a sports bar- wtf.  When she asked the waitress if there were cocktails or a wine list she told us that there was ONLY wine and that it was limited to the house red or white.  Too bad there was a full bar inside that I only noticed after ordering!!!!!!!!!!   Strike ONE.

Strike two- she neglected to ask me what kind of cheese I wanted on my chicken sandwich so I got NONE!  I was so disappointed as I am a total cheese freak.  After bringing these matters to her attention she said she would have the manager give us a discount.

Strike three?  The discount was maybe 2% (like a dollar and some change) of the entire bill.  I guess the gesture was nice and all but if it was such a silly amount it was pretty much pointless.

They put powdered sugar on their sweet potato fries which sounds ok in theory but doesn't work when they're a side to a burger.  It's also quite pricey for average food and terrible service.  Yeah... no.

Not quite sure why this place gets poor reviews. Other than its proximity (it's basically in a mall within Planet Hollywood), the bar itself is awesome. 

There's plenty of TVs with sports, cute waitresses who are quick to take your order, beer pong tables and relatively cheap beer prices. We had a group of about 20 in Vegas for March Madness and we were all thoroughly impressed (this was our second year in a row coming here).

The only downside (outside of proximity) is seats are limited and it's a bit of a shark feeding frenzy when it comes to finding a table.

The wings were awesome.

It's a young crowd here, so if you're over 40 or so you might get annoyed by the volume and drunkeness of its patrons.

Came here starving,got sat down quick,but no one came to take our drinks or food order down.No waitress in sight.very disappointed. Its beyond loud in there also.Screw you blondies and your horrible waitresses. Took our money elsewhere
The hostess was hot, and the food was good. The service was great and the prices were reasonable.

If you want to go to a Sports Bar and be ignored and treated poorly then this is the bar for you.
Went there to watch the second game of the world series. We were seated right away.  We go the happy hour special.  All you can drink from 3-6pm for $20.Waitress brought us over our first 12oz draft in a plastic cup and left.  15 minutes later she came back and threw 2 wrist bands on the table and said that we needed to wear them for happy hour.  This was the last we saw of her.  The place was not busy at all. We saw her and 4 other waitresses stand up at the frt of the bar  I had to go to the bartender and get more beers.  The bartender was going to charge me for the beers because she said I should have ordered them thru our waitress.  I told her I would have but she never came back to the table.  We got one more beer and left this place.    DO NOT GO HERE!  There are MANY other sports bars in Vegas.  Go there!

SO AWFUL. My pasta had a nicw big clump  of hair in it. Did it get to tell my server?! No! She never came back! She charged us for chicken and when i finally saw her and told her none of is got chicken....she argued with me! I know what i ordered. The bar is a sports bar so it is LOUD. These waitrreses are so rude. Dont eat  here

REFRESHING

My husband was automatically attracted to this particular sports bar in the Miracle Mile shops, 1. For the huge flat screens all over 2. To the cute cheer leaders serving the tables. 

We sat on the "patio" and watched multiple waitress walk by and not address our table. As we looked over the menu one of the waitress walked by and asked if we've been taken care of yet. My husband and son quickly said no. Talia quickly apologized for not having a waitress over at the table , and took our drink order. My son (whom is mentally disabled) started asking questions regarding the menu. Talia was very patient and answered all of Roberts questions.  (thank you for that)

We decided on a cheese steak, salmon entree and a rib eye entree. 
Drinks were refilled multiple times, my husband enjoyed several draft buds and the food was exquisite for a "sports bar"

The atmosphere was great! Food was a bit over priced but welcome to Vegas 

Thank you Talia and Blondies team. See you for football season

Came here to kill some time one morning and made the mistake of ordering breakfast here.  $2 bloody marys...$3 mimosas...cheap breakfast specials.  It wasn't even worth the couple of bucks- the food was pretty cheap and tasteless and my bloody mary couldn't even pass for tomato juice.  

This place would be better for drinks and bar food but for games there is a $50 minimum.

The service was pretty good however but again...food not really anything special nor is it even worth the cheapness.

Located in the Planet Hollywood miracle mile mall we checked and couldn't find many better options as far as sports bars to watch the ncaa final four games.  The place had all you can drink beer happy hour and with games on that basically everyone in the bar was interested in, it made for a festive atmosphere.

It seemed hard to flag down a waitress, when i finally did i ordered some nachos that were pretty good.

Would probably go back here if i wanted to watch a sporting event that happened to fall in to their happy hour(s).

So my friends and I went to blondies to have a good time when one of their coworkers thought it would be ok to take a a live video with flash WITHOUT us being in the club yet. She thought it was funny to disrespect us and mock us when we weren't even in there territory. I am shocked and so disrespected. Never go in there because there workers think it is appropriate to take videos of people while they are trying to have a good time.

Great place to play beer pong. They have tournaments that are only $20 which includes drinking! Also you can show your college ID to get discounts. 

The food is ok. We got the sampler plate. Good while your drink but not high quality or anything. We usually just go for a fun place to play beer pong on the strip!
No beer can chicken anymore.  Used Entertainment coupon.  Sports bar, watched red wings game.

Best sports grill I've been to in Vegas! We were seated right away and we had a cute little server named Marissa. We just came for wings, but our server sold us on some nice cold beers:) She was very attentive, friendly, and made our overall experience great. Great customer service & the food was amazing. We will definitely be back again!

Definitely our favorite sports bar on the strip. Every thing I have tried on the menu has been awesome, I love their Cobb salad...it's huge! You'll never miss a game since there is a 360° view of tvs around you. The staff is always friendly - especially our favorite waitress Amy!
The food is great for the portion size. and price to as well.

+ Food was delicious
- 15 minutes for a waitress to get our drink order, service wasn't very good.  Restaurant was not crowded at the time.  Simply a restaurant with a gimmick like hooters

This place is inside the shopping area in Planet Hollywood. Ended up here after walking around and looking for something to do!

They have a bunch of beer pong tables in the back. You can purchase one of their "beer pong" packages which consists of 22 cups and 2 balls for $5, and a pitcher of your favorite beer for anywhere between 15 and 25 bucks.

It's pretty fun for a change of pace from the clubs if you're chilling with a couple of friends :)

regarding fight at blondies,first of all they lied 2 us since we were in line getn ready 2 go inside we were told it would be 60 dollars then it went up to 80 while we were in line it went up to 100dollars we wanted 2 see fight so we paid it we were six of us it was.we were told that it would be all u can drink on some beers after a hr they didint have the beer we were drinking once fight got started the waitresses were taking a long time coming 2 help us when fight got started me and two friends went in to girls restroom and there was guys going in there we were getn harrased in there and there was no security in sight one of the guys that we were with went to tell the manager and he was to busy collecting money from people getn in it is not a safe place to go if ur a girl we contacted the owner when we got back to town and he gave us a big story that there was no complains at all on that day A BIG LIE we will noy go back 2 that place ,and if there was any girls on that day that know what i am talking about you should call that place and complain

If you just want to beer pong,this is the spot.other than that,its cool.This place waaaaay in the back of miracle mile at planet hollywood.almost got lost but finally found it.the best part all you can drink from 3-6 i believe for 20$ which is cool as well

This bar is a nice place to gather and watch a few games.  Me and my travel amigos met here for the Night Crawl group.  The bartenders and the waitress was awesome and the drinks were on point. We even found out that the manager was from Texas.  That made the fun even more better.  When I go back to Vegas I will definitely be going back here.
Their pizza is delish!!!! Curly fries are hot & fresh. Bartenders are pretty fast too. I liked this place - I started a bar crawl here & it was chill.

My new and very improved review!

We were in for the week and stayed at Planet again.  We gave Blondies a second chance to dazzle us.  I am so glad we did!  I'm not sure if the management had changed since last year, or if we were just lucky, but everything was great!

Our server, Gabby, was so sweet and attentive.  We weren't through with our drinks (soda) and she was at our table with refills.  Always smiling, too!  We ordered various appetizers-potato skins, onion rings, wings and nachos.  Everything came out in a timely fashion and was piping hot and delicious!  Gabby came back to our table to check on us many times while we were enjoying the food.

No complaints from us, in fact, we went back a second time during our stay, and Gabby was our server again....Yay!  She was just as great as the first time.  Thank
you for a very nice experience!    In my world...good service equals good tips!
Happy hour sucked. $8 rail drinks. We went to watch a specific game they were rude about changing the channel.  No one seemed to know what the heck was going on. Terrible place. Never again!

I don't get the reviews here; I didn't see anything that reflects all the bad reviews. Basically, it's a Hooters with girls in cheerleader outfits instead of the skimpy Hooters outfits. 

It's a sports bar with sports bar kinda foods. How can the expectations be that high? I don't get it. Huge TVs everywhere, bar, wings, finger foods. 

Came here twice in a weekend. Both times, there was no issue with customer service. Both girls were super friendly and helpful. There wasn't a lag in service at all.

I really enjoyed the sliders here. No high expectations or anything. Wings weren't bad. Sample platter was all fried, what do you expect? They include FRIED mac and cheese balls. Delish! 

Also, if you're a Total Rewards member, you get 20% off! Awesome!

The absolute worst service I've ever had in Vegas. We were unfortunate to happen to walk by hungry. HUGE mistake.  Food was nothing spectacular...never got checked on by our waitress until we asked for the check. Just a waste of time and most upsetting to me.....a waste of calories. There are so many other places we could have and should have gone to for a quality meal....like GR's Burgr! At least that place in Planet Hollywood is definitely worth the wait.

Horrible experience #1 stuff  chewing gum that's the last thing a personstry who works instthe service industry wants to see that ? #2  ,food was cold stuff replaced the food wich is good manager never came to the table to say sorry or follow up ? Tables around were dirty for a long time before the busser realized tables need to be cleaned I  guess on the side corner station where all the gossip and drama goes on and Facebook is more important.....

To all the servers and busser at this place You guys  enberassed  the service industry .

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!! Like other yelpers nothing but excuses!!!! Took half hour for drinks messed up on our order then proceeded to argue with us about it! I am a server and they should know better!!!!!!! I highly reccomend avoiding this place do not waste your time!

If you're shopping at Planet Hollywood shops on the Strip, don't bother stopping in here. Plenty of TVs but you can't hear anything except the beer pong game going on in the back. Service was terrible too.

Fun place to watch the game but food isn't so impressive and it is somewhat pricey. I am rating this on food only. Husband ordered a regular hamburger ($13) which does not include fries and I ordered a cheesesteak ($16) no fries either. Fries purchased separate.  Food was just ok tasting. It wasn't bad but nothing to write home about. I would say they do need to improve presentation (refer to pic). So many other options to choose from so if you are there to eat maybe try somewhere else.
The best damn wings ever!!! Went here twice over a week while visiting Vegas. One of the waitresses Veronica even remembered the mrs and myself! Great food and great service!

Absolutely horrible service.. didn't even bother to stay. We walked up to the door and had to ask the hostess to be seated. He response was "I have no tables," so I asked, if they had any open seats at the bar and she said "nope!" Then turned around and walked away. Won't ever be back.. if that is the service from the first person you see when you walk in, I can only imagine what the service is like inside.

In the bowels of the Miracle Mile Shops in Planet Hollywood casino, so not easy to find unless you're shopping there. I liked it, good sports bar, many TVs, waitress was very friendly and food wasn't terrible.
Basic menu. Wings are below average. There are many other bar and grills you can go to in Vegas. I'd pass on this place.

Blondies is a tough sell on me.  I like playing beer pong, and the crowd Blondies attracts is young and fun; mostly.  However, the beer is cheap and tastes cheap, the food is lower quality than most of the local bars, and the service is below par.  IMHO, there are plenty of better places to go on your night out, however, you should still visit Blondies and experience it first hand.

Thank God it was a free meal because I did a survey next door. But I will never come back here the service was so horrible and the waitress was not attentive and it wasn't even busy. I didn't get a refill for my drink and the cup was empty for 20 mins. She got my order wrong. And that's just the top layer. We had to ask for everything twice. Not only that I waited for the bill for 30 mins after getting tired of waiting I asked for it again and she said she gave it to us. If she did I would have paid it and get the heck out.
That was just the service the food wasn't great either. Garlic fries were dry its just curly fries with whatever crap on it they call garlic. The pizza blah I've had better at pizza hut. The wings were decent but I can get better ones from the freezer at the grocery store.

You get what you pay for and although the pricing is high for where we come from, it's inline with Vegas strip costs. I had a caesar salad, and sandwich with a blondie beer(Great brew). It was accurate and on time. No arguments here. A good stop to fill the appetite and grab a drink.

Located in the Miracle Mile Shops inside Planet Hollywood Hotel Casino on the Famous Las Vegas Strip.  A fun little sports bar that is a little "Hooters-esqu" Just so you know what you are getting into. The food is good as is the service. They have great breakfast specials, worth checking out. they have a pretty good happy hour as well. I will say the prices are not bad for the strip, so stop in have a beer or three and take a load off. Do a little people watching while young are there, what can it hurt? Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

This is the worst service in Vegas. Sat waited 10 min asked again for service. Ordered wings  got that wrong wings arrived no silver ware . waited another 15 min for bill.  Seems to be no manager in charger.
We came here for the happy hour drink special and ended up grabbing a bite to eat as well. I would come back for the beer but not the food.

Think they can't ruin a burger?! Think again.  Plus they have the audacity to charge an automatic 11% for TIP!!!!  Service SUCKED, beer SUCKED, burgers SUCKED - need I say more - don't waste your time - grab anything elsewhere - anywhere!
Just stopped for a drink waiting for the mall to open.  $1.99 Bloody Mary and free Wi-Fi...don't mind if I do.

DON'T GO! I called this place to ask a question about Groupon. "Jen",  the girl who answered the phone could not answer my question because she had no clue what Groupon was. Ok, that's fine... I asked to be transferred to a manager and she said there was no manager there. I asked to be transferred to ANYONE else in that establishment...she said there was no one there, she would have to take a message and have someone call me tomorrow. WOW, I must have spoken to Blondie aka "Jen"  herself because apparently this chick runs the show all by her lonesome. WTF. But really tomorrow? I call back... same take a msg BS and she hangs up. I call back again she says, " I'm f*cking busy and can't deal with this sh*t", and hangs up. ( No shit you're busy Blondie I mean "Jen" -you run this joint alone)  I call back she picks up and hangs up . At this point I am livid, en route to Blondie's and instead of tasting the food there I am about to smack the taste out of Jen's mouth. I call back the manager finally answers, talks to me and apologizes. ( I guess Jen is not the one woman show). At this point I am standing in front of Blondie's listening to her on the other end of my cell phone. The damage done is beyond reparable and for whatever reason I still walk in order a soda. I sat there for 5 angry minutes decide I couldn't stay there so I throw some money on the table and skidaddle.   I CAN 100% GUARANTEE I WILL NOT BE BACK NOR WILL I RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANY OUT OF TOWNERS.  THIS PLACE REALLY NEEDS TO  RE-EVALUATE WHO THEY HIRE AND HOW THEY TRAIN THEIR STAFF AND SERVERS TO TREAT THEIR CURRENT GUESTS AND FUTURE GUESTS VIA PHONE.
Watched the UFC fight there a few days ago, great bartender, fun atmosphere, good food & reasonable prices. We will definitely go back.

I don't know about all the negative reviews, all I've had are positive experiences here and I've been a customer a number of times.  Maybe people are used to getting their drinks for free in the casino, but as far as I'm concerned, the all-you-can-drink happy hour is the way to go.  Great place to watch a game, especially a fight, but get there early for a title bout.  Very good bar food (don't expect anything healthy... you're in Vegas), excellent service.  Love this place.

We ate here and had a few drinks. The waitress was great. But here is the issue: watch the check. The first meal they charged us 2.00 for each vegetable added to the pizza when the menu said 50 cents. They did correct it but blamed the computer. This morning they charged me an extra 1.00 on an egg I had added. Again they tried to pass the buck by the floor manager. I just want people to watch as this must happen all the time.

After this response from the manager I had to respond:

Comment from Von M. of Blondies Sports Bar & Grill 
Business Customer Service
12/10/2016  Menu never said .50cent per topping and the toppings for the big 16inch pizza are always 2.00$ also an extra side is $1 that is correct ... eggs arnt free sorry . Takecare 

Von M

Wow! I'm appalled at your response. I don't appreciate you insinuating we lied on our review. As we went to the hostess stand each time and reread the menu to check pricing. For your information we ordered a SMALL pepperoni pizza and added 3 vegetable toppings as the menu said each was 50 cents per topping. The Pizza was not a 16" like you referred to. When we got the bill we were charged $2.00 per topping. We checked the menu again and it stated 50 cents per topping. The waitress also checked and told us we were correct.  The next morning we had breakfast and ordered one egg with our meal (I know they are not free) and again was charged $1.00 more than what was stated on the menu. Again my husband went to the hostess stand and checked the menu and sure enough we were charged an extra $1.00 more than what was stated on the menu. We had the same waitress in both situations which it appeared she was somewhat embarrassed knowing that this was second time around for us.

I suggest that you get your menu to correlate with your computer and maybe that would solve a lot of your problems. Judging by the other yelp reviews you have commented on, you have done a good job showing your rudeness. My suggestion to you is that if you can't take the heat of "yelp reviews" you need to get out of the kitchen. In other words get another job.  It might save you the trouble showing how you react to dissatisfied customers.

Came here only to find out that my two favorite bartenders were gone. And since the current bartenders are catty bitchy females who obviously didn't want my money (as shown by their eye rolling) I happily took my money and my tendency to tip 50% elsewhere. The food here sucks, anyway.

Went here with a few friends and the management turned what could have been a bad experience into a good one. We (party of seven) were seated promptly, but there was a disconnect between hostess and waitstaff, so we didn't get a server right away. We decided to leave, and on the way out, one of my friends mentioned why we were leaving. The manager found us about to be seated at another restaurant and asked us to come back. He more than made it up to us. The food was good and the servers were lovely.

Everything on the menu is pretty much fried or really unhealthy in some other way. Large portions- get the Groupon if it's still available
Good service and ok food (definitely a brick in your tummy tho)
Adorable hostess and I felt really bad for her cause there's a lot of creepy, disgusting, skeezy guys that come here and she clearly gets sexually harassed by most of them. All the girls that work here have to wear cheerleader outfits and I hope they get better tips for it because they really have to deal with a lot.
Great morning specials
Awesome place to watch the game because there's a million TVs

The trip to Blondies made my trip to Vegas even better. My friends and I went to Blondies during there 7 yr anniversary, they has a 20$ all you can drink beer, which was awesome because we played an enormous rounds of beer pong. But when you first step into the bar the first thing you'll notice is the vast number of big screens they have. Second is the two bars they have in stock. Third the 8 beer pong tables they have ready for people to play. And to save the best for last the beautiful hostesses in their cheerleader uniforms. 

This is a great place to watch sporting event, have a great time with friends, meet new people, and play beer pong. They have great hospitality, great vibes, great music mix, and a good price for a pitcher of beer for pong. 

So I would like to thank Blondies for the great times they have given me and my friends when we were there. Special thanks to my bartender katie. She will always and will be my number one bartender for life. Much love and much respect to that girl.

If I could only describe this place in one word, I would have to say:

CRACKIN'!!!!

but let me elaborate...

A handful of girlfriends and I decided to hit up Vegas. It was our first day there and we were starvin Marvins. We randomly picked Blondie's because nothing else sounded good. So what we order? CHICKEN STRIPS. And man, I tell ya.. these chicken strips were the best I ever had. WE ever had.

We come here the NEXT day, to get MORE chicken strips for lunch. And all of a sudden we hear loud music and people dancing on the bars. We didnt know Blondie's was poppin on a Tuesday afternoon!

I swear we ate chicken strips all 5 days in Vegas and we were fine with that!

Good food, great service! Alyssa was our server and she was so fun and tentative! I had the tacos (yum!) and my husband had the build your own burger. We were both delightfully surprised at the quality! I highly recommend stopping in. And if you're lucky, you'll get Alyssa too!

Great place to watch games outside of the sports book. They have a great happy hour.  20$ aycd!!! Belle was awesome! One of the better bartenders that I've ever had. Beer pong tables/ giant  TV screens and a great staff.

A must on our trips to Vegas. It isn't the best place, but for good service, a sports bar, it meets its mark. Easily the best Buffalo Chicken Wrap I have ever had. First time was a couple of years ago, and we still talk about it. Was there again last week, and it is still just as good. If all you do is stop for a wrap, I'd say don't miss out!

It was my second appearance at Blondies for dinner, and this time to start I opted for a bowl of Spicy Chili, which was excellent in flavor, and true to its name but not overly spicy--yet could have been heated hotter.  Then I followed up with an excellent Build Your Own Burger.  Mine was a half-pound medium-rare burger festooned with lettuce, tomato, pickles, American Cheese, mushrooms, bacon, and fresh avocado slices, which was indeed a mouthful.  And Diane and I split a generous order of very fine and flexible elongated French Fries.  My party was seated in the patio area along the Miracle Mile directly facing a lively, overactive water fountain and the V Theater.  The mood was festive.  Service by cheerleader-clad waitresses was friendly, swift, and accurate.  And only some paper scraps on the floor detracted from the sports bar ambiance.

But, as many have said, food is king.  And, here the food is very good indeed!
2nd time wasn't as great.  greasy as hell.

I guess they don't need customers!  We tried to eat there on 6/19/14 around 10:30 am, I asked the hostess if we could get breakfast and lunch at this time to accommodate our small party of 4 and with attitude I was told "the kitchen staff prefers to only make breakfast that early, and that as the hostess SHE can decide if they can make it, but it's really an inconvenience."  This girl had no manners and was no help at all.

I had absolutely the worst experience I have ever had at a bar on the strip at blondies today. 11/4/14. The bar was busy and the restaurant was too and there was only one bartender. Being in a hurry to get the Britney Spears concert it made it impossible to get a drink before. Completely unacceptable for Vegas standards.

My husband and I liked this place. We would definitely return. Fast and friendly service. Some of the patrons were a little loud but it is a sports bar. It's a nice spot to bring a large group of people who like to watch games on TV. Food was really good and well prepared. Nicely located inside the Miracle Mile shops.

Stubbled upon this place with my girlfriend around 3am after the club and got some wings our bartender Brandon was so much fun! We our coming back next time we're in Vegas highly recommend this place!!

The bartender Brandon made our night!! Not only was his service stellar, but the recommendation on the fish tacos just made the night. I expected this to be a dive, the food and service changed everything. Awsome place for being hidden. I'm telling all my friends to go get the tacos and to roll on in when Brandon is there!!!!!!!!!

Worst place in Vegas 

At first glance this place is enticing, luring unsuspecting visitors to the sports bar setting. Don't be fooled: this place is awful. Starting with the service and ending with the bill, Blondies is a waste of everything: time, calories, and money. I only ate there with my family and friends because the line at the renowned Spice Market Buffet was over an hour and a half long. The wait staff is pathetic, everything on the menu is overpriced, and the food was not even mediocre. You will end up paying $23 per person for a soggy burger, limp fries, and a flat drink. If you can't make it to the buffet, eat somewhere else in the Miracle Mile.
Loud. Below average wait staff. Food OK. Poor beer selection unless you like bud light, etc. There are better places. In the same mall, see PBR Rock Bar.

Get the 'big breakfast burrito'! 

Nice place in the mall and its a reasonably priced reliable place for breakfast. The only thing they're missing is espresso coffee.
July 13, 2016 Had one good night and one not so good. Back to Vegas twice a month. Will give it a go and see if we can break the tie. Sports. Great Location.

This had to have been the worst service I have ever received. After 30 minutes of waiting we had to ask the front staff to send our waitress to us. Once someone finally came she took our drink order which we didn't see for another 30 minutes. Finally we ordered our food and they brought us the wrong order. After taking it back to the kitchen and waiting 15 more minutes we were brought the wrong food AGAIN. Did I mention if we wanted more drinks we had to walk up to the bar because we never did see our "real" waitress, since the only one we saw kept giving us excuses about how she was so busy (this place wasn't full AT all). After asking for the manager we kept getting a waitress telling us she was the best we were going to get. The manager finally came and again, excuses. I will never dine here again.

Initial Greeting: Not bad, however the Host did not know where the State of Montana was? That should have been a sign.

Drink's: Yikes, over 10 minutes for any kind of greeting by our server, and another 10 minutes to get our 3 bottles of beer.

Food: I've had better, but it was not horrid. We waited another 20 minutes to order our food, but it came out in probably 8 minutes (Which makes we wonder when it was actually cooked/prepared). We had no forks/napkins, and would not get acknoledged until our meal was about done. 

Payment: I complained (we were at an hour 30 minutes now). They gave a small comp (which is better than nothing) and even was greeted by the manager (who never actually said he was a manager). After that, I just walked to the bar to pay, because, well.. I was tired of waiting.

Overall: Poor service. Medicore food. I would not ever eat here again. They need more staff, and possibly get rid of them beer pong tables. I hate people reaching for a ball under my chair when I'm eating.

I'm sharing my personal experience because I appreciate reviews, good or bad.
I ordered a side Caesar Salad and a Baked Potato. The salad was very tasty,  the baked potato was undercooked and unedible. The people working were kind; however, the service was VERY slow. Even though they only had like 5 tables with customers, it took about 10 minutes before they took our drinks order and 10 more minutes to bring it to us. Personally I wouldn't go back there.

Another one that took a dive. We ate at Bondies many years ago. I can't remember how far back. The food was exceptional. Granted it's bar food, but I like bar food and the atmosphere is nice. We had tickets to a show at the V Theater and a Groupon came up for Blondies. So it was perfect. Eat, then walk a few steps to our show. We were seated immediately. Our waitress gave pretty piss poor service. We are not extravagant people. I don't need you to kiss my ass because you're serving me food. I just ask that you refill my water, and get me my food when it's ready. This waitress was bottom of the barrel. It took her forever to get our order...after walking past us telling us she'd be right with us. She then explained how it's been soooooooo busy and short staffed. I'm human, I get it. No worries. However, she was off doing god knows what and I see a guy in a t-shirt (a bartender, a dishwasher) I don't know who he is. But he kept running all her food. Um, ok. She's just walking around like she's got nothing better to do. Also, I'm pretty liberal. I don't care if you have tats over your damn eye lashes BUT sometimes what you wear does not go well with your "art." She was covered in really bad faded tats wearing a cheerleading costume. The hostess was gabbing with two friends who came in for applications. She would gab with them. seat someone then back to dishing about how great the job is. UGH. Unprofessional. But the food was good, when we finally got it. Nice girl, but slow service. Overall, with a groupon or a comp or desperation would bring me back. But hopefully none of that is likely. 

I have never had their alcohol I can't speak to that or happy hour specials.

Fernanda was my server and she was great. She seemed to have a busy section and she handled it very well. She was attentive to her tables and she was very nice. We watched the football game and we had the nachos to share and a couple of pitchers of beer that she suggested. Great fun!!

[late post] day 7 of my 10..
brought cousins & one's bff to check out the Miracle Mile Shops @Planet Hollywood for their first time...they wanted to try to catch the 2nd half of the nba finals, game 2, esp since our home team was playing (go, warriors)...came across this lively sports bar w/ tvs everywhere...so, gave it a try...

we got sat at a raised booth with a stripper pole...diff & neat...likey...but wooden seat was hard...

FOOD  |  see my pix of...
- Rockin' Nachos: loaded w/ black beans, tomatoes & cheese topped w/ jalapeños served w/ sour cream & salsa, 16.99  |  add steak, 3 ..."steak" my a$$!...jus some bits...uhhh, almost 20 bones for freakin' nuthin-special-nachos?!...what kind of krack r they smokin'??...
- Pitcher of Rockin Rock  |  14.
- Shots of Fireball  |  4 ...good deal

SERVICE  |  our waitress (kayla) came by to check on reorders, but didn't bus our table...smh, 1 of my pet peeves...

DEALS  |  1) damnit, if i read a lil on yelp, woulda seen that they have groupon!...$50 worth @ $32 (36% off)...good on f&b...must have 2+ persons... this deal woulda been perfect for us given our check total...
2) bogo entrée in the Miracle Mile coupon book, which u could get at one of the info booths...supposed to show an aaa card or w/ another redemption coupon...

CONCLUSION  |  convenient locay, fun atmosphere, large screens, some drink deals, avg food at high prices...

Purchased a goupon which enabled us to overindulge.  My BF and I ordered a pizza, wings.  The wings were ok....nothing special btut the pizza was excellent.  The drinks are a little expensive but our waitress was super nice and informative.  She upsold us on drinks , its a good thing we had a groupon!  It was pretty dead when we went to we were served right away and rec'd our food right away...seems like it would be a fun place with the beer pong set up and all....if there were other peole then just us.

Can I give it a zero PLEASE OH PLEASE YELP?!

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!

I asked the hostess about happy hour, she rolled her eyes at me and gave me the most attitude ever .. I was shocked! But I still wanted those damn garlic fries so I still let her snooty ass walk me to a table .. she tried walking me to some bfe table and so I told her I was going to sit at the bar for quicker service.  She stared at me like I was ridiculous, whatever. 

Bartenders were clueless with their drinks .. wanted to get drunk after a weeks hard work but no where in PH gave me the chance. :(

If you're in PH just get some Earl's and gtfo :) Cosmo across the way has much better customer service AND drinkks!
Just ate a very greasy breakfast there. Neither the hostess nor the waitress had the energy to crack a smile once. Overall, a bad experience.

Great food. Love the tuna sandwich. Cute waitresses, lots of tv's. I eat here everytime I go to Vegas. Perfect sandwich, burger, fries place. Love the atmosphere and there are huge portions for the price.

If it was possible to take away stars from other reviews, I would! Seated right away. 10 minutes later, no one had even said so much as hello. I flag down hostess and let her know we haven't seen a waitress. 5 mi urea later, waitress comes by and says "I'll be with you in a minute". A couple minutes later she finally comes. Order a couple beers and some food. Can't order a glass of water (they only serve bottle) really??!!

Food was average and service remained horrible. No silverware delivered with food. Asked repeatedly for silverware and napkins. 

If you are a local, there is ZERO reason to ever come here. If you are a tourist, do yourself a favor and catch a cab to nearest PT's pub. You will more than save the cab ride in booze costs and get great service.

Places like Blondies make me feel ashamed after I leave. Like I really should have known better!

Worst service I have yet to receive. My husband and I came in and order food and less than 30mins mins later they brought us the check. We has to spend more more $100 to not be brought the check every 29 mins. Worst service I have received yet. At planet Hollywood I would much rather go to a different sports bar. They were not busy at all just wanted to get rid of customers because of closing time. Do not come here.

What a disappointment!

I was here a couple of years ago and ordered the beer can chicken.  It was moist and delicious.

I returned last weekend with friends and suggested the expensive beer can chicken ($17), remembering how good it was the last time.  Boy, has the quality declined!  Before, they used to fit an entire beer can into the chicken, but now, then chickens are so small, they have to use one of those Texas longneck style aluminum beer cans cuz the normal style could not fit in this stingy, malnourished bird.

Our table ordered two of these lame entrees, and both were undersized, dried out and tasteless.  Nothing like I remember it.  Water was free, but tasted like crap (unfiltered Vegas water, I presume).  My friend ordered a margarita on the rocks and had to send it back because it tasted disgusting and was the worst she ever had.  Veggies were overcooked.

An expensive meal for crap food.  NOT impressed!  Never going back there again.

I was hoping for a good (drunk) time but nothing. I like many others got the Groupon deal of an open bar for $10 from the regularly priced $20. Even if you don't have a Groupon, Blondies advertises the best happy your in Vegas: All you can drink (beer or well drinks) from 3-6pm or 10pm-1am, excluding game days. Blondies is located inside the always busy Miracle Mile in Planet Hollywood. It's a great place to catch a game compared to other pricier places on the Vegas strip.

Me and my lady friend went in on Friday, January 17 and we're expecting a wait but it was pretty dead for 10pm on a Friday night. Blondies has some serious square footage and there's a plethora of sports memorabilia and flat-screens littered throughout the bar and grill. We were told to seat ourselves wherever we wanted and we headed towards the back bar. However, we quickly made our way back to the front bar after the bar tender informed us she was closing up.

After seating ourselves, a server was quick to tend to us and we let him know we had the open bar deal. He went on to put a bracelet on us and began serving us well drinks. Simple vodka and juice drinks. The first drink was nothing to brag about. I felt like I was drinking expired cranberry juice while my girlfriend drank orange juice. I knew then and there we were not going to get drunk. Five drinks (each) later we were exploding from a big dinner and tons of cranberry and orange juice. Not even a buzz. We decided to call it quits and take our loss. 

I think my biggest gripe is the inconsistency in drinks. The bartenders were great guys but one was making us real drinks while the other was serving us juice. Regardless I was nice enough to tip every time. The TV at our bar was playing an old UFC fight and my lady was forced to watch some guy get his head and nose bashed in while we drank our watered down drinks. We could have asked to change the channel, but didn't feel like bothering our bartenders. I'm sure this isn't a bad place by any means but I'll have to dispute their claim as the best happy hour in Vegas. 

Ambiance/Decor: 3/5
Food (Drinks): 1/5
Service: 3/5
Price: $$
Overall: 2/5

Pros:
+ Full bar
+ Open 24 hours
+ Drink specials
+ Lunch/dinner menu
+ Cute hostess' and bartenders

Cons:
- Open bar drinks vary in strength

This place is over priced!

Food was ok. I mean this place is cool if you wanna watch the game, drink a few beers and eat greasy bar food. There's like a billion TVs here which is cool! 

Other than that, I probably won't be coming back when I visit Vegas. I like GOOD food! But it was fun here :)
After days of paying stupid prices for breakfasts, w found this place on our last day here. The $2.99 breakfast special was a godsend. Wonderful find. A must do for the next visit to Sin City.

Sensory overload!  Nothing like your eyeballs being pulled in every direction to watch wall to wall flat screens as you try to recover from the night before.  I should reiterate that, every inch of the place is practically covered in flat screens.

That's really the reason you will ever step foot in here.  The perfect spot to watch every single football game being broadcasted.

It's a pretty average sports bar.  Decent beer & food menu.  Maybe it was the booze still talking but an order of loco moco seemed like the best option at 10 am from the breakfast menu.  Honestly, it wasn't half bad and was better than I expected.

Tip - If you've got a group, do make reservations for a table during the football games, as this place will fill up during game time.

My boyfriend and I came here for the UFC fight. We paid the $60 per person for a table and then had all you can drink Bud Light. We pretty much had a personal tv right about our table. Service was great, we had Taylor. It was definitely well worth the money. We ordered potato skins which were yummy and then shared chicken strips and a basket of curly fries which was huge!

1) they do not serve tap water.  I had to pay for a bottle of water!  I tend to drink a lot of water and can easily go through 2 or 3 of those bottles of water in a meal so rationing out my one bottle of water to last through the meal was not the easiest task.  Especially since I was already a little dehydrated and tend to rely on restaurant tap water for hydration when I'm in vegas anyway...

2) The food is kinda bland.  You must pay extra for a lot of condiments/extras that typically come with your meal.  However, I do tend to like food a little on the plain side so I really enjoyed my sandwich.  The turkey in it was really fresh, as was the lettuce and tomato in it.  Not having any mustard/mayo/etc. added to it was a little odd to me though.  It felt like something was missing the entire time I was eating.

3) Loved the steak fries here..

4) a little overpriced, but that is to be expected in this type of vegas dining.
Went here as part of club crawl, and its here when I got pretty lit. Cool sports bar.

Great place to watch a game if you're only requirement is a tv, otherwise, the poor service, weak beer selection, and basic fare make this a place to steer clear from. I wasn't expecting much, just a beer and a place to watch the game, but the service was so deplorable here that I waited almost 10 minutes to even pay my bill at the bar for 1 beer, the bartender was too busy talking to a coworker. I'm nice and efficient as a patron and I appreciate when I get the same service. Unfortunately this place provides none of that. You're better off going somewhere else.
Great place to watch games. Great pupus selections. Great service
They're simply amazing especially how Brianna is now manager i love her work as a bartender
This is for Dirty Blondies...Nice place just NO one in there...Very dead

Bad service!!!!! Expensive, low quality food!!!! I came in with my wife for teacher appreciation and told the server about the promo they had and the server said " everything on the menu." Bill came and said it excludes pizzas. You just said "everything!!!!" It wasn't only just that.... I watched 4 servers stand around talk about shoes visiting with each other when it was a busy crowded place!!! Are you there to make money or just stand around??? Take your business to hooters, twin peaks, Buffalo Wild Wings, even Denny's! They lack service and quality! Come here if your desperate!

My review is based strictly on their mozzarella sticks.

They are amazing!

Other than that, all I can say is that they apparently have a really good happy hour and it is located in the shops at Planet Hollywood. For a quick  bite and a drink though, I would definitely recommend it.

Stopped here for breakfast after a long night, $3.99 breakfast? Sure! 

I had two eggs over medium, hash browns and bacon with a side of wheat toast.  We were the first ones in the restaurant and seated immediately, drinks and order taken.  We were kind of in a hurry because of an early flight and our food was prepared fast and accurate.  

Great stop - recommend if your in the Miracle Mile shops.
It's cool for the location and the vibe is fun. Lots of beer pong and just beer! The customer service is very average nothing to brag about. We didn't eat so not sure about the food.

We went here yesterday to get some lunch. We were seated promptly as it wasn't real busy. After about 20 minutes of no one coming over to even get our drink orders, we got up and left. There were 3 employees standing at the hostess podium when we left! WTH?

This place is ok.

While touring Planet Hollywood an overwhelming sensation for a nice refreshing lemon drop came upon me so, not really knowing where to satisfy my craving, we just happened to walk by this place and decided to check them out.

The place (Interior wise) is nothing really special, just your typical sports bar.

Our bartender was extremely nice and went well out of his way to make some decent lemon drops, especially considering the fact that its a sports bar where lemon drops are not usually a specialty of there's.

Overall, the drinks were ok, the bartender was extremely friendly and the place supposedly gets pretty packed when the games are playing which is when they have some special prices on beers and so forth, but in all honesty, it definitely is not  a place I would look forward to stopping in again.

After 10pm this place rock's.

There service is great; there food is delicious and you can't go wrong with 10$ all you can drink beer.

Great place to meet new friends and kick there ass at some beer pong.
Diffenetly a place to go on tuesday-thursday nights.

I was very impressed with this place. My girlfriend and I went this past Saturday (6/23/12) for lunch. I got the buffalo chicken wrap...which was great. She got the chicken wings...she compared them to BJ's chicken wings. Overall I say this place is good for a quick bite. 
But let me forwarn you, they charge for water...not bottled water TAP WATER. Well, they charged me anyways.

Great sports bar!  The food is your typical bar food, but its really good and the prices aren't bad at all.  Wonderful spot to watch the game, tons of tv screens.  The frozen drinks are huge, strong and reasonably priced.  Blondie's is located in the Miracle Shops at Planet Hollywood....be sure to check it out when you're in Vegas :-)

Pro's: Beer pong tournaments! Good happy hour drink special. Cute outfits for the cute waitresses. Nice people watching seats. 

Con: generic hot wings, Pizza tasted like Domino's

This place used to be a fun place to go to back in 2010 for birthdays, or a good place to watch some Sunday Night FB. 

Unsure of what happened six years later...

I guess what had a red flag was when the hostess sat us literally next to the tv, and asked to be moved she walked away with no customer service. Second, was when a friend of mine asked where the bathroom was, the hostesses conversation was more important ( & I understand when deep convos are made you want to get your point in but the restaurant was slow enough for them to stop what they were doing). Lastly, they kept messing up on our order. If you're going to hire new bartenders the best thing you can do is cater to the patrons needs instead of making your own creation esp when the drinks you are making are bartender themselves. 

Our serve was really chill which is why I gave a star but if she wasn't our server we would've walked out. 

If I knew this was going to be a horrible experience, I would convinced my friends to eat at Cabo for a better dining.

So sad the food is not the same as it used to be. I came back here several times for the awesome greek salad now it sucks. And the garlic fries are horrible too. Basically it's just now overpriced bar food.

You have to be kidding me, a "RESORT FEE" at a restaurant??? Seriously? The food is garbage, the service is maybe a tad better than the food. But, even if the food was awesome, a resort fee is a spit in the face of your customers, it is so insulting that I can't go back. 

Never ever will I step foot in here and I have actually been in here when in town on business at least 5 times with co-workers in the last 2 years. I am so insulted by the "RESORT FEE" that I will tell anyone that I talk to about it as a "can you believe this business practice?"

Gave em 2 stars due to the attitude the blonde female bartender gave me. We were a party of six that went to Blondies after the J-Lo concert. We were told to sit where we wanted. We were sitting for 15 min and nobody came to our table. So, I went to the bar to order our drinks and food. I placed our order with the bartender. She said that the waitress will take our order at our table. I asked if I could order the drinks because no one has come to our table. The bartender rolled her eyes and said "I guess". I placed our drink order. I asked for 3 margaritas, 2 bud lights & 1 Miller lite. She gave me 3 bud lights. I told her that I asked 1 Miller lite & 2 bud lights. She rolled her eyes at me and  said "no you didn't"! I said yes I did,because I don't drink bud light. I drink Miller lite. With her attitude she refused to change 1 of the bud lights for a Miller Lite. I asked to speak the manager. I explained to him what had happened. He said "no problem"' and gave me a Miller lite. We also ordered food from the waitress. The wings and burgers were pretty good. We all have bad days. It wasn't necessary to give a customer attitude over a beer.

I got a livingsocial for Blondie.  I was skeptical about it at first because of the not so great review, but hey 20 bucks for 40, not bad.  Anyway,  i had a pretty good experience with both the food and customer service.  Our waiter was great, but the host wasn't so much.  The host did not smile or greet, seem like she didn't want to be there, not so cheerleader like.   Our waiter was great.  I got the ribeye with sweet potato fries.  I was glad they put the powder sugar on the fries, it made taste much much better.  The steak was really good, nicely cooked and juicy.  Overall it was a good experience for me.

We had a very goog experience , first I value customers service  it is very important , thank-you Alex!
We sat at the bar and get happy hour special $20 all you can drink from 10pm to 1am.
beer & well drinks , you can go walk around and came back for another drink during the happy hour.
if you check in with yelp get a appetizers free.
Our bar tender Alex made us feel welcome very attentive 
good job girl.

I hate to say it, but this time really sucked. Our waitress was very friendly, but she was so stretched that we barely seen her and had to wait 5 mins to ask for mayo and wait ten minutes after we were done eating to ask for a box. Managements fault...not hers. Probably maxing out tables per server to increase bottom line and food cost bonus.

Atmosphere was 4 stars. A lot of action and a fun place. Patrons were upbeat. 

Mixed reviews on the food. Built my own burger and the burger patty was flavorless and bland. Curly fries were great. Cobb Salad was large and fresh, and I thought was quite tasty...but girlfriend didn't care for it.

Even with a groupon, there are better options than eating here.

The eggs Benedict sliders keeps me coming back! well that and the beautiful ladies... but seriously these sliders are a must try! the patio area you have a nice view of the surrounding area. I have tried a few different things on the menu and most of it is mediocre but i would defiantly give this place a try if you are considering it. every time i have been here they have been super friendly to my 2 year old so thats a huge plus. the servers are very polite and well trained and big shout out to the kitchen for plate presentation.

Wow, worst customer service ever. We went there a while back. We chose to eat there cuz my bro in law had bets on the basketball games, so we figured we would go watch the games and drink some beers. -First problem is he asked for a glass of water to go along with his pint, the waitress said they only sell water for $1. Can you say, Illegal? -Second, all of the tv's were on sports center while the games were on. We asked our server to change a tv that only our table could see to the game. She responded with "all of the tv's  have been requested to be on a certain channel by other guests." The place was practically empty. -Third, we ordered a $7 chips n salsa started and received half a basket of chips and prepackaged salsa. I asked for a refill of chips and she said she would ask about refills, and never came back. 
-Four. They had a special for a gallon (ish) personal table beer dispenser. I asked for that with the "blondies"  brand beer and was told they only fill it with buttwiper products, even though it says nowhere on the menu that it was restricted to that brand.
-Five. the food sucked. I didn't expect much from a sports pub inside the miracle mile.. but this was really bad.
-Six and final. I asked to speak to a manager and I addressed all my concerns list with him. As for the water, he told me it cost money to wash the glass so they can't give free water. I just spent well over $100. I think that can cover the rinsing of a glass. 
As per the TV situation. He told me that it is first come first serve, but he would be happy to put a game on for me. (we're done eating now and don't care)
As per the chips. He said he will get us more chips. Again, we're done eating and don't care.)
As for the beer special, He told me that the menu should say its restricted, but won't do anything about it. I told him it was false advertisement and he compared his restaurant to a STRIP CLUB in saying that just because they say you're buying a lap dance doesn't mean you're not going to get a BJ+. 
He blamed all of our problems on the waitress and told us not to tip her if we weren't happy with her service. I responded with fact that it was his fault because he is in charge and even if I didn't tip her, the company would still tax her for it. 
Overall, I will never go back to this dump.

Blondie's target patron is the sports fanatic that is willing to belly up to the bar for an extended time to watch their multiple screens, drink, play beer pong on non sporting event days, and have a good time. Thank you Blondie's, I'll gladly accept the invitation. They are a sports bar and they make no bones about it. I would not recommend this place if you're expecting a quiet, peaceful meal with gourmet food. Blondie's hits the sweet spot for NFL Sundays and March Madness.

We clocked in just before noon on the first Thursday of March Madness and clocked out around 9 PM. Definitely reserve a table online for busy days like this. We didn't reserve a table and started out at the standing room by the back bar. By around 3 or 4 we had four seats across on the back bar with Daniel taking care of us. The minimum spending amount per customer that day was $45, which we had no problem meeting.

We had an unobstructed view of about ten screens all day with just a wave of the hand to Daniel for another round of drinks any time. The specials that day were a bucket of 5 beers for $25 and $6 shooters of Jameson, fireballs, or Patron. We had 7 buckets of beer, multiple rounds of shots, and plenty of action on the games. We did order a large pizza, a chicken quesadilla, and curly fries at some point, but honestly, I don't recall how any of it tasted at all.

The only snags we ran into all day was the restroom situation and the distance of the sports book. The restroom had one stall and one urinal only. With hundreds in the bar drinking, it often created a line out the door. Also, the sports book is about a ten minute walk to the front of Planet Hollywood. With long lines in the book, this leads to about a half hour trip to the sports book if needed. So place your bets early or have a mobile sports app.

Yes, we were gouged on beer prices (we basically paid $175 for a case and a half of bud light), but I had a great time with my buddies and our neighbors and we were paying for the entertainment value. We had better views of the games compared to a sports book. And we had plenty of action all day and won a little scratch. It was a memorable experience and I would do it again in a second.

This place is pretty good. The mozarella sticks were awesome. The wings were ok. I ordered the turkey wrap. It was more like a burrito!! It was good. I didnt really need to order a side of fries but i thought the wrap would be smaller. It was a good experience except for the tv kept getting jacked. They do not check to see if anyone is watching a game before changing the channel. It happened to us 3 times.

I'm not sure why all the bad reviews.  I had a pleasant experience.  I would agree they are a little pricey, but what isn't on the strip?  We had chili cheese fries, minus the cheese whiz it comes with and asked for grated cheese.  They were awesome!  And we also got the appetizer sampler with onion rings, 2 chicken strips, 4 jalapeño poppers and 6 hot wings.  More than enough for 2 people.  And our waitress Ingrid was cute and bubbly and checked in on us multiple times.  I'll be here again next time.  Especially for the chili cheese fries and jalapeño poppers :-)

The only reason why I came over here was to watch the Patriots game against the NY Giants. As District One wasn't showing the game, me and my party opted to go to this place just to grab a drink or two and watch the game. The place was packed with tourists having a good time watching their own team win or lose. While this restaurant is perfectly located at the heart of the Miracle Mile Shops, I'm definitely not a fan of this bar. Err... Restaurant? Whatever it is. 

The server I got was friendly as she consistently checked on me and my party whether we needed anything else such as water, condiments, and food. Besides the service, I'm a fan that I was able to watch the game here as it was really hard to find a bar that actually played it since they needed a sports package. I have to hand it to them, this is definitely a sports joint. 

As for the bar... Don't get me wrong. I don't want to blame my bad drink to the bartender as it's probably his job to fill as little alcohol as possible in my drink and over charge me for a small glass, but hey, it's the Strip so I can't really have high expectations for this place. Usually, when I order a margarita, I would immediately get some kinda of a buzz since I'm very light weight. This had literally no effect on me. I feel really bad for anyone who gets a drink in this place thinking that they're going to get a buzz. 

I also order sweet potato fries to much on something while I watched the game, and man... I don't even want to start telling you how disappointing it is. I know for a fact that they were frozen. But as in cheap frozen sweet potato fries. I've had a frozen fries from my local market than the garbage that I was served. This seriously explains as to why I captioned "meh" on my photo of the sweet potato fries. 

All the while... I got four drinks and an appetizer for about $55. I guess you can say it's not so bad... But the drinks were bad, and the food was bad. I'm on a quest to find a good bar here in Vegas, and this is definitely not one of them.

Really awful experience from the start to the end of my meal. It was as if the bar was purposely trying to turn away service. The food is overpriced and they charge for a side of fries. They have no refills with $4 sodas and you have to pay for water!! (it's actually illegal to charge for water) The tragedy is this place has a lot of potential.
